review: good compilation , but get the original two albums if you possibly can . this ad is from his two original albums or cos : wonderful world of christmas and this christmas i spend with you . robert goblets wonderful world of christmas is the best christmas ad you can get . hard to find , but worth it .

have tried for years to buy this album but was too expensive around the time of his death . enjoyed it so much this holiday season . it arrived in perfect shape . i have ordered things before from amazon and have been very satisfied .
excellent selection from one of the christmas masters of song . it is a shame that more christmas songs of goulet are not available on ad .
a bit expensive at some amount of money for a used ad but i played the ad and i am happy . maybe i will not play this ad anymore so that i can keep it at it is original form .
hello am interested in this ad but 1st , i would need more details know all the songs on it ! thank you !
can not go wrong with robert gouletand christmas !
this was a favorite album in my childhood and i am so pleased to have it on ad now . it is just as wonderful as i remembered .

this is the ultimate christmas album in my house ! i grew up with this album and many others being played everyday between thanksgiving and christmas ! just hearing the first few notes takes me back 25 - 30 years easily ! i turned my husband on to mr. goulet some 10 years ago and now he and our 3 children love it too ! a must have ! i just got the ad last year after much searching . i still have the original album , but the kids can not understand why you can not jump up and down while listening to an album , besides it is nice to have this one to listen to in the van !

christmas just would not be christmas without robert goulet ! it is wonderful to hear his voice again on all of these songs . my personal favorite is this christmas i spend with you . christmas day is a song i have not heard very often , but r.g.s rendition is terrific ! every song on this ad is a winner ! if you love robert goulet and christmas music , this ad is for you !

this is the type of album they do not make anymore , classic christmas songs both religous and secular with great arrangements and orchestrations . goblets version of pants angelicos is breathtaking . i have dozens of really great christmas albums mathis , williams , crosby and this album takes it is place right alongside those . if you like the idea of an old fashioned christmas you will love this album .

again 20 words , whew . the songs are few , knew this . i did not expect reverberation to be used . if i want to hear reverberation , i would buy a reverb amplifier . sent quickly to me . excelent results , no damage to case or disc .

i bought this ad for that one song alone ! my parents had a compilation up now in my collection that included barbra streisand , julie andrews , and many other incredible singers . i think it was a giveaway at christmas at the firestone tire store i no i am not kidding i and the most incredible thing on that whole album was robert goulet singing pants angelicos . i had never heard the song before , do not know latin . but oh my god i picked it up on ebay a few days ago . there were 3 - 4 other copies available . while i do have that vinyl up , and enjoy all of the other songs and singers on it , this is the one i need on ad format so i can carry it some amounted it into my computer , include it in my own christmas playlists . i am looking forward to the other material on the ad , but all i need is pants angelicos . obviously , for me this is the definitive rendition of this beautiful song .
i love it ! by far my most favorite christmas album . robert goulet was a master and to hear him croon some of my favorite christmas songs is awesome !
i love this ad , i listened to the up in college 34 years ago ! i have looked for it before and could not find it . it brings me back .
lonesome amountove and loved robert goulet . from camelot to las vegas goulet . i miss his voice so much . this ad brings back memories .

i am sad that i did not read it long ago . it turns out i have had it on my kindle for quite a while . i loved it ! i love all of farrah books but it was good to read masons story as i would read kieran story first . i love the maplesville and gather , la series as well as all of her other books and will continue to read her stories .

i enjoyed the second installment of the maplesville series . it is short , but feels like a regular book . i enjoyed reading about jada and mason , who are enemies that find they have some naughty things in common . i can not wait until the next installment .

this is the second installment from farrah reckons moments in maplesville series . a little bit naughty is jada dangerfields story . her knight in shining armor is mason coleman , her nemesis throughout high school and the older brother of her best friend kiera . i love jada and masons story and their oil and water relationship . so happy they found love in the end . a short read , but very enjoyable . a must purchase .

i really like this book . the plot was well fleshed out . jada and mason had been antagonizing one another since high school . he has more straight laced than she . unbeknownst to her , he has always been interested in her but had his reasons for keeping his distance and acting hostile toward her . usually , when that is the scenario , i find that the reasons are ridiculous . however , in this case , i did not find his reasons to be ridiculous . i liked the fact that even although jada was not as straight laced as mason , she was not over the top bohemian flighty either . she was actually pretty grounded . anyway , i like how the story and the relationship progressed . there was no jumping into bed two chapters in . i will read this author again .
this was a sweet book that reminded me that there are still some knights in shining armor in the world .
great story . being from louisiana i almost googled to see if any of those small towns are real ! loved the chemistry between the leads well developed characters .

i enjoyed this continuation of the maplesville series . jada and mason were able to begin a relationship that mason had dreamed about since high school . ms. cochon in did an excellent job in writing this book . i look forward to book3 .
this is the second book i have read by this author and i really enjoyed it . i look forward to reading more of her books .

i fell in love with these characters and the author did a great job moving the story along . i am not a big review person so i pretty much keep things short . when i do not feel as if i have hit a snag in a story , it gets 5 stars .
who would have thought mason would be a closet freak ? way to go ms. cochon keep up the good work .
please let there be more to jada and mason i story ! ? i would love to read more about them and see where their relationship goes .

this latest novella from farrah cochon was great . i could not put it down once i started reading it last night . the chemistry between mason and jada was hot . can not wait until the next novella in this series .

i enjoyed this book . the fact that the love making was sweet and sexy made me look forward to each session . i also enjoyed the fact that masons biggest sin was trying trying to take care of the women in his life .

jada and mason appear to be public enemy 1 but they say it is a thin line . find how true that is in this romantic tale . mason has had the hots for jada for years but like little boys does not how to express it . so , of course jada thinks the worst of him . when they clash of her naughty business , sparks begin to fly !

i love farrah cochon and i always forget until i pick up one of her books and am left speechless . this little diddy went above and beyond my expectations . mason and judas relationship was fire , flawed and going to last forever . my favorite kind of romances are love or hate and unrequited love and this was both in one . everyone needs to invest in this book . it is a quick read , realistic and oh so kinky ! can not wait for the next installment !
great quality but the album it is self is kinda eh

with this band you kinda of know what you are going to get . it is not absolutely ground breaking , but it follows a simple formula . there has always that 3 doors down sound thrown in . it is a good album , but i feel like all their albums are starting to sound similiar . this could be my last album from them that i buy . that is not to say they have a bad album because they do not . plus their packaging is always cool .

i am a writer , so music is a necessity for me . listening to differing types of music helps me to set the mood for different scenesrock music for action scenes , and more upon looking at some mp3 albums on here , i had the thought to look for 3 doors down , seeing as i have always enjoyed their music . so far , this is my favorite album by them . , i was bobbing my head from the title track time of my life all the way to the end . i am addicted to more than one song on the album , and now listen to it every day . seriously glad i found this one , and for some amount of money i think it is way worth it . do not pass this album up !

i have been a fan of 3 doors down for many years , and i like all of their past albums 5/5 stars , but this time is different for time of my life , this album disappoints me just a little bit . i rate this album 4/5 stars , because there is not one song i really connect to like i have on their previous albums . i know every band evolves after so long , but did they pick the right time to do it , this many years in their career ? i personally think they are starting to sound more mainstream , and i do not like that much . time of my life is a bit of a change from their previous albums , this album is softer than their previous albums . i do not think this time around , that this album was worth the 3 year wait . this album is still good , but not great like their other albums .

i have been a 3 doors down fan from the first album . if you have been also then you will not be dissapointed nor surprised by this offering . the formula is there and add does not break from it very much . it is just a good rock album as all of them have been . i doubt that the fan base will expand because of this album but they certainly will not lose any fans over it . these guys have settled into their comfort zone long ago and know what they are doing and seem to have fun doing it . simply put , if you have bought their past albums then buy this one . if you are not a fan and know little about this band , i suggest picking up their first album which has the hit superman on it and give it shot . you will probably be hooked and start buying the rest in short order .

i really liked all their previous cos but i just can not connect with this one . there is not even one exceptional song and the overall tone strikes me as having a country or redneck flavor that does not appeal to me . i am disappointed because i actually liked the last ad better than the previous one so i was not expecting such a drop - off .
this is truly a great ad with great acoustics and lyrics they give a top performance with no exceptions . if you like them , you will like this .
one of their best yet . i highly recommend this to fans of this genre . it is awesome and i loved every song .

here you have 3 doors down with their new ad and let me tell you it is one of their best ! it is an album you have to listen to a few times and then you know what i am talking about ! real great stuff and everyday i have a new favorite just like believer , round and round and then there has heaven just great . but this is just my review and i am a big fan from holland and i love those guys to death . my least favorite is race for the sun but after 01:40 i love the song . it is just a matter of taste but i recommend it to everyone who loves great music without the reviews of some sites !

i love three doors down but honestly only one song stands out on this ad , yup you guessed it , when you are young and while it is a good song i can only take so much . all the rest of the songs blend in together and i was pretty much disappointed for how much i payed for this come amounts just say i expected much more and maybe a few heavier songs in the mix .
this band has been putting out stellar stuff but have to stay this one is just ok . there is the same old same old and some new vibes songs going on here .

i have come to respect this band a lot . they deliver some of the best melodic rock available nowadays , along with incubus . this is a very good album that represents it is maturity and evolution since the kryptonite days , following the here without you breakthrough .

3 doors down is by far my favorite band , and this album does not change that . this album , just like every one they have put out , is just as good as the the last ! this album is exceptional . the songs on it give you such a great feeling , with a different feeling with each song . my favorites would have to be heaven , what has left , and round and round , but every song on this album is awesome ! five out of five stars without a doubt ! love it ! also , the bonus did is fantastic ! it includes i think four songs from time of my life as well as kryptonite , away from the sun , and let me be myself . it is pretty awesome ! great purchase and you will love it !
this is a great ad just a good rock di do not see how you can not like this one
great ad . great band . not as good as their other works , but still great !

if you like dogs and sweet romance , this is just up your alley . fast paced and sweet . love it . this is a great little read for a holiday evening when there has too much going on to kick back with a novel . romance and action : a great combo .
a great holiday short read . it has a good plot and a sweet romance for both people and dogs . give it a try , you will not be disappointed .

very short and easy to read . middle school reading level but with adult content . no descriptive sex . i would call this a quick fluff book , very little content . several typos through out the text .

a quick read with characters it is easy to care about , this story is perfect for a lunch or midweek evening entertainment choice . no explicit sex whatsoever . as a short romance , in which the characters need to get to the hea in very few pages , the story holds it is own . well edited and written . recommended .

it is christmas time and i am so busy , but can not put my kindle down . this is the perfect short story . a romance with just a little suspense for the holidays . it is a cute short story so you can get it read and onto all the other stuff that needs to be done . i hate for a book to end , so i did think it could have been a little longer .
cute story but without a great deal of substance . would liked to have seen a longer , more involved story . otherwise , okay .
what a fun book . very enjoyable , will keep an eye out for this author . loved the characters , dogs and christmas setting

expected a sweet christmas story but found a shallow tale with limited believability . the storyline had potential . it would have made a great detective novel , only the juicy details were bunched up at the end like an after thought . next christmas i expect more excitement from this author .
this was a quick read , but very enjoyable . nina kept a light tone overall even although the criminal was of the most despicable sort . the characters both human and canine were very likable .

this short feature was full of favorite things : santa , dogs , cops and love . throw in a frustrating mystery case and characters who actually get out of their heads and attempt to communicate with each other eventually , make this one a keeper . it was really a fun read .

lonesome amountovesome amounted this short story . it was sweet and cute and chock full of happy , feel good moments ! the characters were endearing and likable , the dogs adorable , the writing was excellent . this is a lovely and quick holiday romance that left a huge grin on my face . i absolutely recommend this to anyone and everyone ! it is my new holiday go - to for rereading !
i really enjoyed this fun short holiday story . romantic , sexy and dogshit more could a reader want ! definitely worth a quick read .

nice , short story . both characters were likeable . their pets were equally or more entertaining , and cute . i loved how the heroine is able to help the hero with his investigation at the end . i would have liked the story to have taken longer than it did for the characters to get to know each other . it seemed too sudden .
a light holiday reading it was certainly worth the price . i would pick up another book by this author

this is a fun read , keeps you on the edge of your seat wondering what will happen next and how will the characters get out of their latest problem . seriously , this is a tense , taut thriller that is not filled with blood and gore , at least not too much , just enough . the author makes you feel the characters stress . it is not overly complicated and you might wonder why some of the characters bad decisions are not more obvious to them . but it is an interesting page turner . try it , you will like it .

for a stand - alone novel , this book had a horrible ending . if it had not been on my kindle , i would have thrown the book across the room . i feel that the story is incomplete and waiting for a sequel , but there is no sequel to this story . the only reason i gave it 3 stars was due to the action packed read , even although you have to get one - third of the way through before the action grips you . once you reach that part , the book is difficult to put down . then the ending leaves you with multiple loose ends that will never be resolved .
great read ! lots of action , well written great adventure story ! i had a hard time putting the book down ! it leaves the end open for a sequel and i hope there will be one .

book dragged for most of story and then ended suddenly . the final paragraph simply stopped the story in mid event as if the author simply gave up too tired to finish . that or he had a heart attack in mid sentence and someone else wrote the end .

i struggled to maintain enthusiasm for this book . the characters were pretty one dimensional and failed to garner my sympathies . the author clearly set this up for a sequel leaving me unsatisfied at the end .

i love this choir and discovered them on their last release several years ago and made it a point to purchase all of their previous recordings . i am a baby boomer and think that their ministry is anointed and that their songs are theologically sound and touch the soul . i love their church as well !

i had never heard of emily barker and the red clay halo but i heard the theme song while watching the wallander series on pas and wondered who was performing that haunting song . so i checked out the music credits and found emily barker . i began sampling her songs through amazon.com and other websites . i found her albums are not available in the states at a reasonable price but found a used album through the amazon marketplace . i must say i love every track on this album , especially nostalgia , disappear and oh journey . the lyrics and the music make a distinct blend that is creative and fresh . these songs stay in my mind and i find myself humming them at odd moments . if you like folk or country you really need to check out emily barker .

this was not what i expected . i felt that by listening to the song nostalgia , this would be more folk or folk rock , but it seems to be more of the country bent . however , she is very talented , i do enjoy this ad would purchase more by this artist .

i was not familiar with emily barkers music other than wallander so i did not really know what to expect . after listening to snow , i can say that i am still not all that knowledgeable of her overall sound but she is most definitely talented , clear of voice and one he shall of a song writer or musician . this is not the type of music that i , personallysome amountisten to until i am tired of , but rather will re - visit at various times when i either need a break from my normal listening habits or when i re - discover this album as i shuffle through my play list .

i found this music because of the author henning cancel . his books about the detective kurt calendar have been so good . i saw that the bac has made a film of one of the books starring kenneth branch . it was filmed in sweden but everyone had a british accent . funny . the film was really good and followed the book closely . at the end of the film an interview with henning cancel was included . he talked about the renaissance of art in scandinavian and got me started on going deeper into the genre . the music for this wonderful film included this group and i liked the theme so i ordered the ad . i have listened to it over and over and it is now one of the albums i can sing along with in the car . i will buy another .

when i first heard this music as the theme song on the kurt wallander bac movies , i knew i wanted to hear more . i was not disappointed . often only one song is a real winner , not so with emily ad . every song flows effortlessly to the next and none break the mood . everyone i have played this for has been impressed . i even shared it with some of my friends from the phil folk festival staff , who were equally impressed . maybe a us concert appearance is in your future ?
not an easy album to find , but the haunting music will transport you . the singer has a unique voice and the songs are unusual .

i first heard emily barker on the pas calendar series . after paying attention to myself continually enjoying her songs on the show , i decided it was time to get the ad . good decision . the music is now on my mp3 and my car device . i am good to go .
the best thing about this album is the theme from wallander . the rest of the ad is a lovely blue grassy feel .
great . found this after watching wallander on the to . great series . the ad is really good . i have also ordered a few more from the band .

i came to this fine album indirectly after being captivated by the pas series wallander with kenneth branch . i bought the single nostalgia from amazon mp3 . well , being the music addict i am , i had to have the rest of this album , so i took the plunge half expecting one great cut and the rest forgettable . well i can say that every cut on this album is just great . my favorites are nostalgia and the greenway but all are compelling , and the interesting blend of emily vocals with the red clay halos accompaniment is truly hypnotic . instruments used beside guitar , are piano , flute , accordion , cello , and musical saw . really a great album and worth the price , any price . thanks to emily barker and the red clay halo for their great art . despite the snow

i bought this album because i love nostalgia the track used as the theme for the pas show wallander . it is the best cut on the album worth the price . the other songs are enjoyable also because she has an interesting voice . reminds me of natalie merchant .
bought initially for nostalgia theme song for callender mystery series but was pleasantly surprised to find that all songs were excellent . great voice and instrumentation .
this is my new favorite ad my wife and i listen to it almost every evening . emily barkers voice is stunning , and the lyrics she writes are haunting .
can not say enough good things about this i or i , this group , and these songs , just wonderful . highly recommend you get it and tell your friends .

this is my first experience with emily barker . i learned her name from watching the wallander to series with kenneth branch . the first song on this album is used as the title song for that show . as a huge fan of american bluegrass and old - time , i was interested to learn about her australian folk music . emily voice is beautiful , and her backing group the red clay halo is pure genius : guitar , cello , fiddle and accordion . who would have thought ? it adds up to a a percentage enjoyable listen . highly recommended .
great musicsome amountreat price and fast delivery had me quickly transported back in time .

great 90s band who is still making music today . this ad has half a dozen great songs that you could listen to over and over again . it is hard to categorize : easy rock , hard pop but basically it keeps you entertained but does not prom other people around you to turn it down . the first 5 songs are the best .

this ad is one of the few cos i own that i actually like all of the songs . it is quite rare that a ad impresses me that much on a first listening basis . like a lot of people , i listened to matchbox 20 a long time on the radio before i ever bought their ad , thinking that the ad probably was not going to be very good , but the matchbox guys proved me seriously wrong ! the very first time i listened i loved absolutely every song on the ad , and became an instant fan . while the music is not exactly always cheery , rob thomas lyrics and music speak to you in a way that is universally true and leaves you feeling pretty good after you listen . if you do not have this ad , i would suggest getting it . you will not be disappointed !

this is one of the best albums i have ever heard . i love it . rob thomas lyrics are true to life . it is clear he with deep inside himself to write many of the songs . the band members do a wonderful job arranging the instruments . i have heard matchbox 20 play live , and it is just wonderful to hear the songs come to life . this album can fit several moods and situations . it has been there for me on good and bad days . this album does what many albums do not anymore . the lyric can be interpreted in a variety of way . i love it .

the readers of rolling stone magazine were right when they chose matchbox 20 as the best new artist of 1997 . with exquisite instrumentals and ethereal vocals , this band has blown away critics and music lovers alike . the incredible songs on this album have a definite profound quality , and one can find so many different meanings in the layers of depth that rob thomas lead vocalssome amountyricist has created . not to mention the beautiful guitar melodies and crashing drum beats . unlike other albums , the songs on yourself or someone like you actually sound independent from each other . compare the soft back 2 good to the pounding busted and you will see that this is not another cookie - cutter band . matchbox 20 may be popular , but that fact should not discredit them . this album is a gem , one of the few that never leaves my ad player . i found someone who seems to understand me in this music . because i am not the only one who has terrified of no one else but me .
wonderful ad . a refreshing change from the garbage which dominates our music charts here in the uk great tunes performed by a superb vocalist a tight band .

my musical tastes are quite eclectic to say the least . i move from bach to rock and all places in between as long as it is quality . however , whenever i listen to back some amounted , i feel like i am actually transported into the body of a person who has deep pain and sorrow . this song continues to have an effect on me over 10 years later from the first time i heard it . most of the other songs are great for the unusual mix of depth and pop appeal . this album is highly recommended !

what can i say about this album except that it is great . rob thomas : singer , songwriter , heartthrob , he can do it all . i am lucky , because i do not listen to the radio and i hardly ever watch mav or vh1 , i have yet to get sick of the songs on this ad , i bought it when it first came out and i still listen to it constantly . best songs : body there is a lot of hurt and pain in this song , when i first heard it , it made my cry shame , back 2 good any song that has the guts to use a bassoon in it gets my vote i and hang . if you have been living under a rock and have not purchased this ad , you must go buy it know .

it is a great c.d. but after a while you have to put it down for a little bit . still i can honestly say it can really pick you up while your feeling down . i really like real world . as long as you do not over play it you will love it for a long time . also if you ever get a chance , their concerts are awesome .

in late 1996 , matchbox 20 started out with their first album yourself or someone like you . the first single long day was in no way a success . but when push hit , the album took off . push , real world , and 3 am remain possibly the best tracks on the disc . the album is truly amazing . here are what i think ofthe tracks . 1 . real world 3:53 5/5 2 . long day 3:47 4/5 3.3 am 3:48 5/5 4 . push 4:00 5/5 5 . girl like 3:46 4/5 6 . back to good 5:40 3/5 7 . damn 3:20 4.5/5 8 . argue 2:58 4/5 9 . body 4:10 4.5/5 10 . busted 4:17 3.5/5 11 . shame 3:36 4.5/5 12 . hang 3:48 4/5 this is truly a great album !
matchbox twenty is my all - time favorite band ever i will never get sick of them and this is my favorite album

rob thomas is one of the best singers in the world . this is the album that started it all . almost every song was played on the radio . this album will be a collection must for many decades to come .
lead singer rob thomas is a great singer and all the songs are full of meaning . if you like push and 3 am then you will like all the songs on this ad .

i bought the old ad as soon as it came out and loved i to death i listened to it e very day and i was first in line for the new on as i listened to it ther was no comparison to the first album i do not know what happened but this ad is way overrated becase the first ad was soo good

rock opera ? yes . rock i roll ? no . crap ? definately . this music is way too overdone and the singer needs a serious dose of testosterone . at least jack white has soul . this might be the best band of the taking back sunday and jimmy eat world emo - punk - pop genre , but that are not saying much . if your into this type of music , take a step back , take a deep breath , and buy the kills album , or the black keys , or kings of leon for something with real soul . i am getting sick of this kind of music featuring prepubescent teens whining about women and life in the most annoying and immature way possible . the blink-182 / yellowcake also crap clones must be stopped before they ruin rock forever .

okay , all i heard from covered when i first got this was a favor house atlantic . i had nothing else to buy , so i decided to get this album . the first few times , i found it a little hard to listen to , and did not like it very much , but over time , i fell in love with it . now , it is three months later , and i still can not stop listening to it . if you hear some of cohee's music and you do not like it , just keep listening to it , and you will be obsessed after awhile . be patient , and try to get into this , because this is good music .

covered and cambrian are truly an amazing band . their style is considered emo , something that i am not too fond of . but this band is different . claudio sanchez is a master vocalist , with high pitch squeals to low end thunder drama that sends chills down anyones neck . his guitar riffs are odd , yet surprisingly catchy . the lyrics tell a story of wassome amountove , murder , and mystery . joshua upwards drum chops bring the songs to life , with amazing dynamical refuge that seize every moment of this record . the technical difficulty of travis steers guitar sound speak for itself , and michael todd brings it home with bass lines that will send even jonathan ruth to the principals office . in keeping secrets of silent earth:3 showcases their wonderful talents and provides professional rock anthems that will send your heart pounding with excitement . i recomend this album to anyone who is into rush , led zeppelin , the flaming lips , the used , or any good rock music . very well done .
if you think you are a fan of music , you are nothing until you have fallen in love with this album like i have ! not even jesus could have made a better ad . buy it and your whole life will change !

i have been listening to covered for about 6 years . i first herd about them from my sister who went to school with them , and the second i herd delirium trigger , i knew that they would take off . in keeping secrets is a perfect answer to second stage turbine blade . all the tracks have a great sound . there is not a song that i do not like , but cuts marked in the march of men is my fav . it does not suprise me at all how good this ad is . word up to my boys from yack ! . show them where you come from .

i bought this ad because i really liked the song a favor house atlantic . while this is a good single , the rest of the album is just really boring . if you want to listen to a another concept album , done infinitely better , check out deloused in the crematorium by the mars volta .

i first heard about these guys from my cousin . he told me , you should listen to these guys . they sound like rush , only better . so one day , after being bored with what mainstream rock was feeding me , i gave my cousin a call and asked the name of that band . little did i know , after that phone call , that covered and cambrian would soon be my new favorite band . at first when i heard coca associated with the term emo , i thought about a bunch of whiny guys singing depressing music . boy was i wrong . you need to own both of cocks cos second stage turbine blade is the 1st i believe because they are both awesome . covered and cambrian are really skilled musical artists that do not get enough attention , although they are now starting to get more mainstream , whether you think that is a good thing or not i will leave up to you . i can not wait for their next ad coming out later this year . i will definitely buy it and will definitely see these guys live . this is truly an amazing ad , i recommend you buy it today ! today already , what are you waiting for ?

i have heard this album in my friends car a dozen times he loves it . i find it unbearable . most of the songs have no discernible melody , or drive , or genuine emotion . i hate this album for the same reason i hate modern rob music . there is no real passion in the singing or songwriting , only a grand display of pretentious melodrama . yuck . listen to a band with actual songwriting skillssome amounting guided by voices or the beatles .

where do i start with this album ? most people put this under the categories of punk rock . well , honestly , i hate punk rock beyond belief . this is nothing like punk . for one thing , it is an album that makes you actually think about the lyrics . for another thing , sure the lead singer does have that weird hair and beard , but at least he has not one of thoes punk or emo posers that have no talent . if i could , i would give this album ten stars out of five . so , overall , if you like to hear music that has a lot of thought in it , buy this album !

bad songs , bad album . although i do own all 4 of there albums , this is garbage . the band seemed to go in a different direction of sound compared to albums 1,2 4 . get there 2nd album the second stage turbine blade there 1st album the penelope ep if you can find it ! the 4th album good apollo , i am burning star , volume one : from fear through the eyes of madness is amazing too !

this is the best thing that happened to me after pizza . this ad is so ! good . i can not comprehend what it must have taken to create this album . this ad is unique , there will never be another one like this , not even from covered if they had 10000 years to work on an album . even if the vocals isn't better than good apollo or set , even if the guitars , drums , base isn't better than good apollo , this is still the best album ever . i do not know what makes it this good , it just is ! sometimes i think these guys come from another planet . this is soo good !

i was quite happy with set , not my favorite but definately worth listening too which is an honor these days . i heard this album was out so i picked it up . i was blown away . deep , dark , emotional lyrics with hidden meanings mixed perfectly with a blend of old school , new age , emo and indie music . i can not get enough of this ad . favorite songs are three evils embodied in love and shadow and a favor house atlantic .

a great ad . covered never seems to stick to one particular style , a good thing . the vocals have an amazing range and no one song sounds similar to the other . first song recommendations would be 2 , 4 , 7 , 8 . not very good at remembering names , sorry . this band has no limits and could end up anywhere they want . also try glassjaw or thrice .

this is the first time i have written a review , but this band has compelled me to do so . i have been a coheedcambria listener since a few weeks after they released second stage turbine blade . i was a big fan then , but with the release of in keeping secrets of silent earth:3 , i simply can not contain my enthusiasm for these guys any longer . coheedcambria paint a sinister epic saga through their songs . the lyrics are vivid , yet leave much to the imagination of the listener . the band has honed their sound and put together what i consider a breath of very fresh air in todays pop - driven manufactured - music scene . kudos to coheedcambria for simply writing the music they love to write , because i love to listen to it ! may the next installment of the saga be as groundbreaking as the last two !

maggie is back and better than ever ! i love her friendship with sam , and the return of her family , including her imperious grandmother . i am glad she gave us some little diversions into another case while in the middle of the main story , and i especially enjoyed the courtroom scenes . maggies wonderful sense of humor is great fun , and it was nice seeing her get attention from two new men on the scene . of course , we all still love digs , too . the ending is her best yet ! julie , bring us book 4 as soon as you can !

i have just about finished this great book . once again julie ramson displays her talents as a writer , this is a wonderful series . i love maggies many trials and tribulations , sense of humor and her fierce determination in solving the crimes throughout the series .

i was hooked after i read the first maggie flaherty book . this one did not let me down . missed having digs in more of the story . i even liked jake , boy was i wrong ! starting the fourth book now , i am sure i will not be disappointed . keep them coming .

i just finished framed . for murder . once again , julie ramson has crafted a story that is riveting and funny . all complete with a surprise murderer . now that i have read all 3 maggie stories , i feel as she is a good friend - someone i really like and with whom i can identify . i hope there is a fourth book coming !

julie ramson returns with maggie flaherty , and when you get maggie you get her entire family and friends . in this installment maggies friend sam finds a body on her porch , an ex - boyfriend . the knife in his chest is sams and suspicion falls firmly on her . maggie does not believe her childhood friend could hurt anyone and vows to find the truth . the third chapter of the series is a step up from the first two books . the story is crisper and moves faster . the book is still a little longo much descriptive background that does not add to the narrative . the reader does not need a description of a courtroomlaw and order has educated the masses . i can usually spot the bad guy but i was surprised here . that does not happen often . have downloaded book some amountook forward to it .
good story . a twist with maggies best friend , sam , accused of murder . digs is in a quandary . he knows sam is innocent but needs to prove it with or without maggies help .
maggie flaherty is now my friend . i bought all the books in the series . and i am done with my review .
ramson rocks again as she leads us through another crime . every time i thought i had figured out who unit she leads us somewhere else ! now for book 4 !

i loved the series . i could hardly put the book down . as a roman catholic and a wife of a retired policeman i could relate to the character . the book was interesting and well written . i would recommend this book to anyone who likes mysteries , romance and a humor . much better than the dishnetwork t.v . selections i had for the week . sheila

absolutely loved this book . action packed from start to finish . the characters were very likeable . highly recommend for those who enjoy a good thriller along with a close family life , romance and humor between the characters . had a hard time putting the book down .
book 3 of the series is just as good as the first two . light read but characters are great . aways a good plot . very good at keeping you guessing as to who is actually the murderer .

this is the third book in a series about an irish , female lawyer who routinely gets into and out of trouble solving murders with a sense of sarcastic , hilarious humor that makes it impossible to put down . her dog , killer , must be a borderline canine diabetic , eating cookies and needing to go out all day long . if you can not put this book down , then you must do what maggie does , order in , which is a good idea if you love hamburgers . this is a great thriller , fun to meet up with her family and friends again and wait not so impatiently for her next episode . keep em coming , these are great reads .

always good to fine a new author who weaves an interesting tales and at a low kindle price that is a mystery in itself i have read 3 of this series all enjoyable and an easy read . my only criticism is that of most new authors ; editor needed ! several typos and parts could be streamlined . a good editor would solve the new author pitfalls

all 3 maggie flaherty books are fun with excellent character definitions . even the dog has a distinctive personality . the mystery is complicated and good enough to keep you guessing . you would like to embrace the main is follow.characters as friends after meeting them in the book . hope more sequels follow . jan

a story of faith and determination and the strength of friendship . when you really know and trust a friend , you can not stop believing in themwhen if all the carefully arranged evidence proves they are guilty of a dreadful crime . only a careful built legal defense and a bold effort to uncover evidence could save her friend , but maggie can do it . exciting book !

i love kiss and they shattered my rock and roll fantasy of them on this album . i hate i was made for loving you . it is a disco sell out . they made up for this cruddy album with more rock but i still do not own this album because of the disco junk on it !

hype sticker has kiss 40th anniversary logo , 180 - gram vinyl , and states that reissue edition is first united states . vinyl pressing since 1985 . reissue up packaging is true to the original with prism logo record sleeve and a reproduction of the original album poster . i listened to the record through headphones and the sound quality of the reissue is excellent . if you are looking for a sealed copy of kiss dynasty vinyl , i highly recommend this reissue .

this album was not bad could have been better but considering the last kiss album in the 1970s with the make up on their faces the album closed off a decade that kiss ruled along with the stones and aerosmith .
this is the original line up . paul , gene , ace and paul . this is the real kiss

aces solos on 2000 man hard times make this a must have for any kiss fan . yes the lead song i was made for lovin you has a disco beat , but it is a great song ; and again , ace let us it rip on a great solo . peter criss is pictured on the cover , but does not play on the album . anton fig of david letterman band handles the drum work . because of peters absence , technically you can not consider this a kiss record . but setting that point aside , dynasty is the last great record kiss ever made . it is the great song writing and aces signature guitar that defines kiss for me ; and this is the last kiss album where ace really shines .

after licking their wounds from the solo disasters , kiss came back with dynasty . but this was not really a comeback as much as it was an unstable atom trying hard not to fracture . it kicks off with three rapid fire shots then falls apart quick . i was made for loving you was pop disco as only kiss could have imagined it , and compared to most dance tracks fron that era , holds up rather well . aces reading of the stones 2000 man was probably his best moment on record as a singer . finally , sure know something was a great single that somehow got lost in the backlash that had formed around kiss . unfortunately the rest of the album gasses out from here . history tells us that internal strife and excess was beginning to tear the band apart by now ; listening to dynasty with that backstory behind it hints at why the remainder of the record sounds so uninspired . great cover although . i had that poster on the wall although college !

i remember buying this album when i was in 8th grade . at the time , i was not sure how i felt about it . i remember that it gripped me in the back of my mind when i thought about it although . snap to 2007 ! the album i had back in the day had been long gone with maybe a few others that i loaned out and forgot about . i just bought the master on ad and after watching histology , i must say , dynasty was the end of what we all knew of kiss from back in the day . this album finally gave ace and peter a bigger roll vocally , which i was glad to hear . to me , it was about time that gene shared the spotlight with ace and peter . paul is all good , no criticism there ! dynasty is a group album , no one leads the way , it is shared and i am glad to seeher that . i never listened to any new kiss after this . i consider this album as a great end to the band we all newsome amountranted it is not as core as earlier stuff , but a fine exclamation point to a wonderful run .

dynasty is kiss 7th album , and until this point the band created some of the greatest , coolest heavy rock ever . dynasty is the last album with the four original members , and the last solid album from the band . dynasty is pretty good , and if you like the legendary kiss you will like it !
big kiss fan . i bought this when it first came out and again just recently . still one of my favorites .

the year is 1979 , disco and pop are all the rage . it was the time of leisure suits , john travolta , beetles , and studio 54 . how does a hard rocking band like kiss compete ? by going along with the times . i quote paul stanley . you could write this stuff in your sleep . if we can get a hit doing this stuffsome amounts do it . of course i am talking about the awful i was made for loving you . they play it live occasionally only for nostalgia . the best tune on the album is by far aces version of 2000 man . i also like hard times also by the jendellian visitor . the entire album is basically soft pop , including aces which surprises me . after his barnstorming solo effort , i thought he was ready to rock out with his misstates . more than likely gene and paul had other plans for the bands direction . listen to dynasty then listen to hotter than he shall , you can barely tell it is the same band . this album was the beginning of the end for kiss , the original lineup anyway . it was not until creatures of the night that kiss got their heads out of their butts . unfortunately , ace and peter had left by then .
my all - time favorite kiss album . great re - packaging , which features original poster and album art . love it !

why ? this album sent kiss into the gutters for years . it was made for the wrong reasons . kiss was always the anti - disco and they did this . i would not recomend this album if your looking for righteous rock . the only reason it deserves 1 star is because of ace and his kick ass playing .

this is sort of a strange album for kiss . following the success of the solo albums and alive ii kiss was one of the biggest bands in the world . but even the biggest band can not live in a vacuum ; by 1978 disco was in full swing , and kiss sought to take advantage of this by releasing dynasty . several of the tracks on this disc have a very disco feel to them , particularly the intro track i was made for loving you . sadly , this foray into more modern music signaled a decline of sorts for kiss , as their popularity waned somewhat from here on out . that is not to say dynasty is not a worthy kiss album , just not one of their best .

then it is one . by this time in their career , they had lost most of their original audience by turning into a kiddie band . six year olds were at their shows with their mommies . so what does doofus gene do ? turns them into a disco band ! oh vey indeed . stick with everything up to alive one , then forget the rest . you will not miss anything .

this album has gotten a lot of criticism . if i would have been a little older liked kiss prior to this i would probably feel the same way those people do about it . it was a departure from what kiss had been doing . by this time the product marketing toys , comic bookstore amountunch boxes so on was out of control the solo albums were promoted with a massive advertising campaign that turned off many fans . i even heard one fan say this is not rock i roll ! so then comes i was made for lovin you , a disco flavored huge hit more to commercials promoting the return of kiss . all this understood , i was young enough that i was attracted to the same ad campaign that turned off so many . i was , after all , the target audience . years later i am proud to say i would end up liking kiss for the right reasons when i got a little older . this was my introduction although so maybe i am bias but i think dynasty is a great album . it remains one of my favorite kiss albums .

like being able to get it earlier than in bookstores.cheaper too ! for a years subscription i would only be able to afford two of the print editing.am glad it is available this way for people like me who like more depth in their film coverage .

very entertaining and informative magazine for movie lovers . for me it just seem to get more expensive for this year and as i am cutting back on subscription magazines this one i have to cut back on . still a great magazine !

this magazine is great , very reminiscent of the old premiere magazine where in only movies and actors were discussed . it has many in depth interviews and also rates upcoming movies and television . definitely worth the low price of some amount of money per year for kindle subscription .
this is best magazine for pending movies for us geeks . even my wife who follows all the reality shows more so than movies could not stop reading
i love this magazine ! the articles , photos , and info on up and coming movies are right on and so much fun to read !
i think it is the best digital film magazine out there . the digital copy is really convenient and cheaply priced .
the online version exceeds expectations ! i enjoyed the features .
i am a movie nut and this publication fills all my needs . i just love it . love it . love it . ditto . that is all folks .
great magazine . i am in the us , and even although this is in the u.k. it is a great read .

i like this magazine . i like the articles and the pictures from the sets of movies . i am only giving it 4 stars because the kindle fire version can be frustrating . sometimes it can be hard to blow up pictures to get the full detail and other times the meaning of the picture is lost due to how it is presented in segments on the kindle rather than as a whole in the glossy paper magazine . i love getting the kindle version for it is conveniencesome amountightening fast delivery and smaller effect on the environment . but i do wish that they would fix the kindle fire format of the magazine so that it worked better .

the name says it all . total film is the only film magazine one needs for all the inside info on the latest hollywood offerings . unlike many entertainment industry journals , it focuses on the filmmaking process and leaves the star gossip column to lesser magazines . if you want to know the latest juicy info about your favorite stars sex likesome amountook elsewhere . if you are a film fanatic and wish to read about hollywood movies from concept to screen , then total film is for you .

it is always amazed me that the uk has two great movie magazines and the us has none . but i am happy to subscribe and get total film here in the states . there are two good uk film magazines : empire and total film . empire tends to be more formal and serious while total film really has fun with the subject and in my opinion , a bit younger vibe . i really love both and have subscriptions to each one through ipad and one through kindle . what i can say about the magazine is that these guys love movies and it shows in every section . each issue has a wide variety of topics without all the highbrow elitism that was so prevalent in premier magazine . yes , you can love pacific rim and rosselini at the same time . you get to try a month free with kindle highly recommend checking it out .
as most magazines go , some issues are better than others , but usually a good read .
i did not order this . if it is been billed to me , it is an error or a scam .
i would probably give total film all five stars except for one thing that diminishes my enjoyment and that is the editors tendency to toss in generous amounts of british street slang . oy !

if there were a zero review , i would be first . this is the worst christmas album i ever heard . i got madder and madder and took it out after the 11th song . celtic thunder , how could you put out such crap ? it taught me a lesson . never pre - order anything ever again . ! i am giving my two copies to goodwill .
great soundwonderful voicesmemorable songsnothing to complain about but to enjoy sit back and enjoy the melody

irish music is among the best in the world if not the best ; celtic thunder is the best at singing ireland others music ; this is celtic thunders christmas album . excellent selection of christmas songs sung by a . hey . celtic thunder . music is repeatable . just do not tire of this christmas music . i like it . just saying .
if you like this group you will love the ad . i have given several as gifts and all got rave reviews .
love all the celtic thunder cos , this one is just as wonderful as all the others

the song selection is disappointing . so many songs that lend themselves to a more celtic sense of the magic and mystery of christmas were passed over in favor or christmas bubblegum . true carols i ones with a more ancient aura i would have been welcome . nevertheless , the lads are in great form !
lovely addition to our christmas collection . ad came in a timely manner .

celtic thunder does not disappoint with their beautiful and amazing mixture of sounds and this christmas album is no exception . from the soothing sounds of silent night i think this is my favorite version of all time , to the tear - jerker christmas 1915 , to the upbeat sounds of i wish it could be christmas every day this is most certainly a musical delight that you do not want to miss . this is dark - chocolate good , if you know what i mean !

one of the most enjoyable christmas did or cos we have ever seen or listened to . fantastic musicsome amountreat vocals , especially paul byron , fantastic performances , very cute guys . we can not have enough of their music or performance . we have ordered every other did or ad by these guys and are playing it on a daily basis . we are looking forward to purchase their new did or ad heritage coming out this february .
the did and ad of this concert are both great ! everyone of their concerts are terrific . makes a great christmas present .

i absolutely loved this ad ! i ordered it through uvc when they had their rose of travel song , and i must say that it took my breath away ! i have been a fan of celtic thunder from the beginning , so i am perhaps a little biased , but i also absolutely love christmas music . tears were brought to my eyes in several of the songs , especially silent night and our first christmas together . on celtic thunder christmas , you can hear some of the classics silent night , winter wonderland , and more but also some newer classics baby , it is cold outside as well as some phil coulter originals our first christmas together and christmas morning dougal . i was definitely not disappointed by this ad . i believe it is noteworthy to include that on baby , it is cold outside , is a duet with ryan and a woman whose name i do not know . if you are a fan of celtic thunder and christmas music , this ad is a must have !
my husband loves celtic music and he listens to it more than i do but i also love this music .
great holiday songs i have been a celtic thunder fan for a ong time . this will become one of my holiday staples .
if you have seen them on to , you will appreciate the wonderful voices they have . if not , enjoy them anyway . nice and refreshing .
as usual celtic thunder came through with good music , however i did not like the place they recorded this album . and where is the girl who sang on it is entertainment . she was by far the best .
i wanted the background music not the actual songs

i bought this ad within 24 hours after seeing the movie years ago . i pretty well wore it out playing it in my car and singing along with it . so , i had to buy a new copy . i am usually not a fan of compilations , but this collection of songs is really well - done . the steve earle song , me and the eagle , is worth the price of the album itself , as are the songs by lucinda williams , iris decent , gillian welch , and emmylou harris , but they are all on the same album ! plus , there are great songs by the mavericks , the flatlander , george strait , and on and on . just a great album .

what a great concept , to have an album of songs inspired by a movie ! although only a couple of these songs were actually in the movie , they all feel comfortable and familiar , although i would never heard them before . reminiscent of the lonesome but contented feel of tom booker and his ranch . great western sounds , more traditional than what i hear on the radio lately . i enjoy the different sounds to the voices , sad and crying sometimes , independent and glad of it other times . good mix of vocal ranges . great album for an evening in front of a roaring fire .

the movie was a huge disappointment . at least 30 minutes too long , desperately in need of editing , and spending way too little time on the horse whispering and too much on people whining . however , this collection of country and western songs inspired by the script and a couple that actually got into the film is a winner . every performer on here does a good job with a worthy song . unlike the movie , the soundtrack may even be too short , considering it is quality . good balance of styles within a genre , of male and female voices , of sad and happy tunes . steve earle does a nice dylan imitation on his number , only with better diction than bob could manage .
the disk has great tunes performed by great artists , although you may not hear them the songs or the artists on the local cowboy station . do not pass on this ad .
great product , and very happy with purchase . item is perfect and as expected . thank you
a beautifully compiled soundtrack brought the motion picture to mind . i listen to this ad in the car often and have recommended it to friends over these past few years .

thank you . thank you . thank you ! whoever was the creator of this ad . thank you to robert bedford ; for reminding us all of the wonderful , spiritual feelings of the old style country music and life - style . the huge mountains and farm lands that i miss so dearly . thank you for bringing me back to my roots that i am not afraid or ashamed to admit that i love . too bad this world has gotten so far away from the simple things , the beautiful . real . things in life . nothing fake or plastic here . life is made to be loved again . thank you for this wonderful ad !

i loved the movie and the soundtrack was wonderful . i only wish that i could access the end title song because i think it is awesome . the reason i loved the movie is because i too have a horse and raced until i had my daughter . i wish i could still have the time to ride and race again and the movie let us me remember the good times .

i was disappointed in the ad thinking that i would get nothing but the soundtrack . i feel the description did not indicate that all songs were not from the movie and that is why i was very disappointed . i purchased it for a friend as a gift and they live in canada . they too were surprised and disappointed . because of logistics , we are not going to bother to return it . it would cost much more just shipping it back and forth to each other . the description needs to be more descriptive and state that all songs are not from the soundtrack . in going back to the site to see what i did wrong , i find i am also rather puzzled why the original score is some amount of money's it that limited ?
the movie was okay , but several songs on the soundtrack were great . excellent ad .
the only really good song is a soft place to fall but just for that it is worth the price .
i ordered this soundtrack to use for musical freestyle and there is not really any music on it that i feel is appropriate for what i wanted . i was not familiar with it before i ordered it .
i a little country which matches the horse whisperer . love the movie , love the music !
this has the main song from the motion picture , and then the rest are fill in country songs , it is ok

tone loc does not really get much credit for spawning the west coast rap scene but he was one of the first back in tha 80ssome amountreat album great beats and it is a huge break from all that west and east coast gangsta rap that you hear nowadays . old stool rule !
yes i liked it because i heard it in my childhood i would recommend this product to other people thank you

this is one of my favourite albums of all time . the production by the dust brothers beastie boys pals boutique , beck delay is uncluttered but very tasteful . it is mostly sample based with the occasional drum machine or bass played by flea red hot chilli peppers and vocals by idea davenport brand new heavies , but all the songs parts fit so well , it could have been created from scratch . tones vocals glide smoothly over top and no , he has not trying to change the world , but he brings humour and a relaxed feel to the strong production . the album did take me a couple of listens when i first got it in 1990 but the more i listened the more i liked it . it has a distinctive groove and is very easy to listen to .

this is a very good album period . great beats to all the songs and tone loc has a very original and good voice . the lyrics are pretty good to and it just makes you relax . i wish modern hip hop would be more like this . i would recommend this to anyone with an interest in quality rap .

i was about 10 years old when this album came out and i thought it was great at the time . i recently bought it so i could take a trip down memory lane and it was really a lot better in my memories than it is in reality . there has not a lot of creativity to his songs . he does have a unique voice , although . there are a couple of songs i guess i will probably listen to now and again for nostalgic reasons , that is funky cold medina and wild thing , but overall , meh .

i remember chillin to tone loc way before do dre hit it big with the chronic stuff . i mean , come on , either you are a cheetah believer or you are not . i admit that this disc is not solid all the way through , but let us give tone his props . wild thing and funky cold medina are classics , . buy it ! .

tone - loc burst onto the scene in early 1989 with the now classic wild thing . the song sampled van havens james crying and had a video that clipped the style of the iconic addicted to love and featuring lots gravelly voice , the song soared up the pop charts to number 2 . the album climbed even further making it to number one becoming just the second album by a hip - hop artist to do as such . the album also features lots ode to spanish fly which is a tongue - in - cheek rap that uses a ton of samples most notably foreigners hot blooded . it rose to number 3 on the pop charts . the rest of the album is fun , but nothing is a memorable as the hit singles . cutting rhythms does have a fantastic break sampling band on the run and the homies pays tribute to his boys in the hood .
tone - loc rose to the top in 89 i or this album is still out there doing his thing check him out . : ams . d.m. spitzer
hey this is one of the original hip hop artist that still creates new rappers telling stories on grandma and grandpa back in the day on music .
this is old school rap that was not obnoxious , over bearing and full of curse words . this was a fun album to listen to where what he was saying ment something and you could understand the words
came out in 1989 . use to bump this all the time . had this on cassette . late 80s rap . listen to it .

being from the mid - west , i did not catch on to tones early regional hits , but i do remember the summer of 89 when wild thing hit the top 40 airwaves , and another hip - hop hero was discovered by me i did not finally get around to picking up the album until recently but it is worth it the dust brothers were definitely on - point producers whoa figured that they were a couple of white college students ?

ignore the two radio cuts , which were beefed up with hard rock guitar samples for crossover potential , and dance to the spare but utterly funky backing tracks on the rest of this album . i just found my old cassette copy and . this is way funkier than many of the hip - hop albums being released these days . sometimes tone is too much on the beat and throwing out what you would expect ; other tiresome amounting on cutting rhythms , he leaves nice wide spaces between lines to let the words hit .
we misplaced our old tone loc ad and was very glad to find this item on amazon and at a good price .

this ad features tone lots two smash hits from the late 80s , wild thing and funky cold medina . these songs are both undeniable rap classics . unfortunately , the rest of the album is not as good as those two songs . most of the other songs are pretty forgettable , although on fire is pretty good . the album reaches a definite low point with the five minute long instrumental loin on the shaw , which loc does not even appear on . fans of old school rap may want to get this ad , if only for the two hits .
i really liked to core premise of the story . the integration of the greys the augmentation technology was well done . i would recommend this book

for me , paying some amount of money for a kindle book was expensivesome amount , as i read so much i tend to focus on the 99 cents to some amount of money but this was worth it . once again , an aliens about to destroy the world book , sort of in the style of independence day . i really enjoyed it . the various characters were enjoyable and the various new technology was great . the elite group of humans chosen to be enhanced to cope with the aliens and slow them down was good fun the 2 alien species were good and as often indulged the area 51 conspiracy people combined with the ultimate twist . excellent battles and there was no feeling of trying to get thru the whole story quickly , so a good read . the possibility of a sequel was not a problem as this story still had a great conclusion .

sacrifice i found this book to be easy reading and an awesome story line ! this is well worth the read for any sci - fi fans . seth libby could become the next guru of science fiction tales . once the background is established you have a hard time putting the book down . awesome !
fast moving , well written although a little short on detail in some places . i really enjoyed reading it and hope to catch the next book in the series when it comes out .

i recommend it to anyone who likes a bit of military in their sci - fi . while a little incredulous at times , it is an interesting read with some pretty believable human traits in there to bring the characters to life
the book show the level in which people will sink because of the lost of love ones , but how they will rise to help others . it had the normal villain and hero , but also the unexpected . good book .
very good book . i did deduct one star for the corny use of lightsabers and the force equivalents . still will read a sequel .

i have never been one to read a sci - fi book , however i could not put this book down . while the authors influences are obvious , the story is masterfully crafted . i am anxiously awaiting a sequel .

quite a good action packed story . slow build up and ever increasing tension , somewhat unique story line . good twists and turns in the plot that did not telegraph where it was going . good characters albeit on the thin side . the tech is believable but never examined in detail , which is just fine . all in all a very good first book by a new author , well done . some of the things that keep it from being a 5 star effort are ; some cheesy dialog at times , some sequences and descriptions should have been done in more detail , and others were overdone . the author needs to keep a close eye on showing the story more , and keep the tell in check . i will definitely buy a sequel , but the author needs to rethink his pricing if he wants exposure . i would have passed on this book at the some amount of money price in a heartbeat if i had not exhausted every other possibility for a quick purchase among the new authorssome amount of money1.99 to some amount of money is where it needs to be if he wants to get known quickly .

i do not usually read scifi fantasy , but this caught my attention . i could not put it down once i started it . i loved the how it was told by time frames instead of just chapters . can not wait for the second book .

sets series has many flaws that irritate your and you are , to and too i which should be picked up at the proofing stage , but the stories do not lack dramatic presence . they are unashamedly space opera and minor matters like the utter improbability of ramming as an attack methodsome amountiven the vastness of space do not detract from the overall arc of the story . i am looking forward to the next installment .

actually i only gave once 1 star . but : take a classic 1st contact story without imagination put then a young adult naive story with a pretentious style add the view of those patriotic american views mix with a super team of 9 enhanced men that crunch almost by themselves 2 advanced fleets then bring a super enhanced human beating all the superhero top it with such poor knowledge of man evolution on earth and you get a bad of . i gave it 2 stars because i least it does not bring also faith into the picture
liked the plot and story line . some of the action was a little hard to believe . however , overall an interesting book .

this was a good read , it started out wee land kept getting better from there . i am glad i spent the money to buy it and i am on my way to see if theirs another one from this author on amazon . enjoy

this was a great read . it had a similar feel to past so - fi greats with a good storyline and smooth reading . i pondered on getting this book but i am very happy i did . it was the type that put action and good story together . i hope there will be another in this universe but if there is not it remains a great read .
i love robert mammon , and it was a treat to read a short story through amazon prime .
if you want a fast , hold your attention short story , this is it . read it in one sitting .
robert mammon true to form ! bravo ! creepy entertaining

this is the first time i have read anything by this author , but after this chilling and powerful introduction , i plan to read more of his work . he evidently writes in several genres , but this darkly delightful blend of sci - fi , and horror in a sort of noire setting , is outstanding . an almost empty late night diner , pouring rain , impending tornado , innocent travelerssome amountocal law officer , and an overlap between the physical world and a haunted , spirit world . this story has it all .
this is the first story i have read from this author . looking forward to more . short story so i read it quick but kept me on the edge of my seat !

so i now know this is the same story so as usualsome amounted it and feel better now that i have been corrected ! exactly like a story from either the twilight zone or outer limits from years ago . a tad different ending but very disappointed . i used to love his books .

i had forgotten how much i loved this story . my mammon knows how to breathe life into his characters . i had always wanted a follow up to this tale , but i am guessing after 25 years that is probably not going to happen ! laughing out loud ! this story can be found in the excellent book , blue world . yep , i would recommend this story and author .

there are a lot of good novelists out there ! short stories . not so much . this supernatural short was beyond awesome . it will stick with me for a long time . it covered the scene , the back story , and the actual story in a spare elegant fashion . i highly recommend this story ! all the best , jay
mammon is my very favorite author . i have read much better work from him .
3 1/2 stars . good writing , so - so story line .
