if you are a genuine lover of music , whether it be classical , dance , rock , or whateveryou will undoubtedly be impressed by the talent which has produced this excellent piece of work . track fourageispolis is one of my all time favourite tracksuit is just so unusual and enchanting . this particular track is ambient , but has a sound through it which makes the whole room vibrate while still being relaxing ! ? very cleverly done . if you have other apex twin albums , but find them a bit mad or even scary , then do not worry because this one is different and is very calm and unobtrusive . i used to put my stereo on quiet and go to sleep with this playing some nights . it is one of the few albums i have considered getting a second copy of just incase this one gets damaged . one last notif you read the other reviews , you will see that the artist has a strong international fan base and , although the music is a million miles from being mainstream , many , many people have been affected in a positive way by this thought inspiring musical genius and have realised that it is truly something special .
i think this is a pretty good ad but i must say that i think it would only suit someone who has a like for ambient or electronic music . i do not see this appealing to wider audience .

this album is one of a small cluster of electronic records designed for listening and reflection . this inspires music that aims for the scope of a symphony orchestra , and the subtle emotional ripples of great piano - trio jazz . listen on headphones to fully appreciate the bubbling and bright possibilities of this album .
so ahead of it is time . interestingsome amountayered , callout .

to think he was 14 when he started making this ! the best ambient music . almost 20 years old but sounds timeless . highlights : xyhal , ageispolis , heliosphan , we are the music makers , ptolemysome amountreen call . very recommended , and a must have for any apex fan .

very nicely done ad . wonderful ambient or i'm style music well worth the money . been a proud owner of this ad for a while , now , and listen to it often , when i am in the mood for this sort of music . definately a worthy addition to anyones i'm collection . possibly even a standard of any i'm collection . apex twin knows how to do it , and do it right .

this is one of apex twins earliest works , some people find it hard to believe that these tracks could have been made by someone as young as our mr. james but , that is irrelevant . saw1 is a collection of some of his best work and is the missing link between his polygon window and apex twin aliases . the album captures the true essence of his work , simple melodies which build with other sounds to form layered musical masterpieces . the production is raw and at some times even poor but , this adds tremendous character to the album would recommend you turn off those woofers ! as for the songs , the first 2 are fantastic chilled tunes , they drift like dead astronauts through space . the third was used recently by gary rhodes on his cookery programme ummm ! . green call is a pseudo - miami bass masterpiece which you are thoroughly not expecting after the subtle eno ambience of the previous track . he samples gene wilder to good effect in we are the music makers . ptolemy and delirium provide the mav at 2 am feel and are probably best heard at that time you will see . ! . buy this .
amazing album ! this is a classic , full of tracks that can pull anybody into a metaphysical trance . if you are into the chill genre , this is right up your alley . get it .

it is too bad this ad is not readily available to the public . james throws 13 awesome tracks down in the first volume of ambient works . the otherworldly sounds on tracks tha and hedphelym seem to come from inside james mind . inside that mind of his is the inner workings of sheer genious . no other artist can combine the ambient sounds of electronics with the seemingly unless sounds of space . apex twin takes you to an amazingly beautiful place in your own mind . where aural pleasure is your own god . worship the twin .

heard tal on a college radio station back in the early 2000s and was instantly addicted to the soundscapes on this album . i have probably listened to this album more than any other album that i have ever brought . managed to score a reissue on vinyl which is not bad since the price for the original goes for some amount of money on discos . i highly recommend this album if you are looking to explore in the vast world of music .

i really like the first half of this album a lot , but the last half just seems to run together especially the last 3 songs . every song on this ad would be considered ambient , excluding green call , which is still a very good song . if your a fan of apex twin , i would recomend buying this .

i think that in order to appreciate the true value of this breezy collection of richard james greatest ambient experiments , you need to turn the volume down . way down . this is not a rave ad , as some may suggest . it is music that is best enjoyed sitting in a room in front of two evenly - spaced speakers connected to a decent stereo set at a mid - low volume . so rarely do we approach music as a complete experience it often serves as the backdrop to a social event or a workplace , or provides filler to an otherwise silent space . selected ambient works 85 - 92 is not for dancing , driving , or doing dishes . it is for listening , in the same way one thoughtfully stops to listen in earnest to birds that have been chirping all the while , or to classical music at a symphony . the music was created with this kind of attention , and the listener must listen in kind to truly appreciate james magic .

although apex twins selected ambient works : 85 - 92 is primarily an ambient piece , it actually has some great appeal . songs like tal , tha and pulsewidth are incredibly relaxing and soothing pieces ambient classics ! . the electronic noises are superbyoull love most every song on this album . there are no voice samples here ; everything is digital . every song , except for green call which is kindle interesting is , essentially , an ambient masterpiece although ptolemy is more energetic and less ambient . if you are looking for an incredibly relaxing album then selected ambient works : 85 - 92 is a very very good purchase along with b12s electro - soma , the orbs adventures beyond the ultraworld and boards of canada music has the right to children . highly recommended ! highlights include : everything except for green call
a great album for dance parties . this album has some really nice dance rhythms and sounds , with a twist of techno . if you like dance it is good . if you like techno it is even better .

ok , i admit that i am partial to richard d. james , but this album is absolutely flawless . while musically his stuff has always been advanced , this ad really bridges the gap between his usually weird to the casual listener sounding works and danceable , poppy music . where in later releases james eventually adapted a more blip - bleep , frantic breakfeast style , in saw 85 - 92 every single track is organic and lush sounding . the major difference between saw 85 - 92 and saw volume ii for all you non - raj or apex twin fans , saw volume ii is a later released double album is that saw 85 - 92 is layered with catchy pop hooks and clubby industrial beats . think orbs little fluffy clouds , except more aggressivesome amounts vocal samples , and more variation . almost every track i almost , not all has a steady beat and is danceablethis is not brian eno ambience , but ambient techno . while it is not exactly chill room music , it is perfect at the end of a long party when everyone is tired and ready to collapse . brilliant , and a must listen .

this is one of the best metal albums of all time . it has catchy riffs and break - neck drum beats that stand up to any power metal album ever made . if you do not already own this album , stop wasting your time reading this and place an order .

this is the foundation where all speed metal started at . so many metal bands were started from this one ad . the next 2 cos after this one were the foundations of all power metal . so many metal bands were started from those 2 cos as well . that is the history that ad . the music itself . kai hansen singing is a little off here and there , but the guitar work is outstanding , and this is kick - you - in - your - face and take no prisoners metal . halloween would never be this heavy ever again , even until today . this was before michael kike came into the band . he would come into the band on the next ad that came after this one . also , if you like the halloween ep and walls of jericho ad , definitely make sure you get the batallions of fear ad and follow the blind ad from blind guardian. those 2 blind guardian cos are a direct clone / exact replica of the halloween ep and walls of jericho ad from halloween . even kai hansen sings some on the follow the blind ad from blind guardian.

this is one of the many reasons why i gave the middle finger to heavy metal and started listening to innovative death metal albums like deaths symbolic and celtic frosts into the pandemonium . it is nothing but the same damn power chord usage and sing along verses and choruses . kai hansen sounds like he was castrated to keep his absurdly high pitched voice and the drummer uses the same old double bass technique . this is for old , old school metalhead who refuse to grow and branch out into new territory . check out blind guardians imaginations from the other side for quality power metal . go listen to hypocrisy the fourth dimension if you want a diverse , unconventional otherwise known as false metal piece of music . p.s.-anyone who considers this definitive 80s german metal needs to listen to creators pleasure to kill , sodomy persecution mania , and destructions sentence of death or infernal overkill . those guys make halloween look like a bunch o nancy . metal heart signing out now .

well i did not care for this album till the day i downloaded victim of fate and how many tears and i was absolutely knocked down by the speed , fury and melody of these songs , then i decided to get it and i saw how stupid i was as i never gave it the attention it deserves.it is not as melodic or as original as the following albums , it is just a traditional harsh - headbanging - metal filled with lightspeed guitar riffs and pounding drums hammering your head for 70 mins.doubt itwill , give a listen to victim of fate , cry for freedom , ride the sky , heavy metal is the law , metal invaders and how many tears and you shall know what the fuck i am talking about ! a friend advise : if you enjoy metal you need to get this album right now , you shall certainly bang your head till the end of it !

if your like me and get a hankering for some teutonic head banging speed metal from time to time , this is usually one of the first discs i turn to . mind you , this is not the silky - smooth michael kike or andy debris fronted halloween , this is the speed metal or borderline thrash kai hansen fronted halloween . somewhat roughly produced , with mais nasal vocals , i have heard it takes some people awhile to get this album . i do not understand those people , i guess . there is nothing here but blazing melodic riffs , screaming vocals , winnowing bass and pounding drums . i challenge you to listen to ride the sky or victims of fate and not snap your neck head - banging or blow out an acl rocking down with your air - guitar . oh , and the guitar solos are a thing of majesty , words can not do them description accurately . just get yourself that new two - disc re - issue of this , quickly !

walls of jericho os an amazing album on it is own but the bonus disc is worth the asking price all by itself . the sound quality is great , the songs are amazing as they always have been , the bonus tracks are not to be missed each one solid . very happy .
halloween is a great german power metal band . and this ad is a great ad with their first recordings .

halloweens walls of jericho shows the real importance of kai hansen in the band . all the fast riffs , the epic choruses . all of what halloween was about was because of kai hansen . so , there has no surprise in finding gamma rays albums very similar to walls of jericho , and of course , if you like mammary , you will like this one .

this is an amazing album . the first halloween album i ever heard was dark ride . this album is much darker and more powerful . if you like speed metal or thrash this album is a must buy . probably their best . the newer albums seem toned down a little bit . i suggest this album and both keeper albums as well as dark ride and rabbit do not come easy . halloween is definately one of the most underrated bands around today . if you like metal or shred pick this album up !

halloweens debut is more of a thrash - metal vein than their more melodic keeper albums . this is not a bad thing at allthe album is full of great guitar and driving rhythms , a bit more metal and less melodic - rock than the next four albums . the main difference , although , is that while the following albums would have the more melodic singing of michael kike , here guitarist kai hansen is on vocals . while i really like mais singing in gamma ray in fact , i prefer it to any vocals in halloween , on this album he has a really harsh , unpleasant tone to his voice . i mind you , halloweens longest running and current singer andi debris does , too , but he has a bit better than kai here . if you like the vocals of debris or motorheads lemmy , this probably will not bother you , but i find the vocals on this album and , to a lesser degree the debris - era i kind of grate on my ears , and i am not always in the mood for it . the music itself is maybe a little less polished than later albums , but has that first album or underground - metal charm .

this album is very different than anything halloween has put out ever since . but this , in my opinion is their gem . this is straight up speed metal , and it is damn right amazing . the guitars are so melodic , the bass makes my skin crawl , and the pounding drums just make the whole sound elevate to a next level . on walls of jericho , you get to hear kai hansen singing his brains out and he does an amazing job at it . ride the sky is one of the most amazing songs i have ever heard , the guitars are really melodic . reptile has always been one of my favorites , on the chorus part , you can hear the bass follow mais voice , that makes the hair on the back of my neck stand up ! heavy metal is the law has got to be the coolest heavy metal anthem ever , this song would make even man o war bow down to them . in short , you have to get this album to understand why so many years after it is release , it is still regarded as one of the best speed metal albums ever . the review on the bottom is also me , only that first i had done it anonymous .

halloween are pretty much known as the originators of power mettlesome amountargely due to this and the two keeper of the seven keys albums . walls of jericho is a melodic , fast , rip - roaring metal album , that at first listen you could easily call thrash . while it can easily hold it is own in the speed department against the thrash bands of the time , it is obvious there has something else going on here . because it sounds a lot like iron maiden too ! so what the he shall do we call this stuff ? that is power metal , kids , here in it is purest form . unfortunately it is a tad underrated , and i always felt it should be one of those required reading metal albums . the keeper albums are and rightly so , but jericho should be tacked onto those two albums as well , although the sound is a bit different from those albums - more raw and thrash . no one sounded like halloween . these guys were still are a very original , talented and extraordinary band . checks out walls and see where it started .

back when this album came out , i remember how some publications slagged it off by saying halloween were ripping off metallica and iron maiden . funny to see , some 20 years later , that their brand of heavy metal is the most raped formula in the epic or power metal movement . back in 1985 , halloween were a thrash band with a huge knack for writing memorable melodies and devastating thrash riffs and harmonies . unlike fellow german thrashes like destruction or creator , halloween preserved a lot of traditional metal in their dna , with virtually no punk or hardcore overtones except , maybe , the frantic pace of most of the songs here in . ride the sky , heavy metal is the law and the thrashing closer , how many tears are staples of speed or thrash metal . the vocals of kai hansen will please maiden fans and the drumming of into r.i.p. , with it is frenzied double bass mayhem , will surely please most thrashes . the album has lost none of it is impact and in no way does this sound dated this is , after all , power metal defined ! . do yourselves a favor and buy this album right now !

the vocals are a bit scratchy and hard to understand , but this album is totally brilliant . there is not a single track on it that i do not like . it is harder than halloweens later cos for sure ; this may be a good or bad thing depending on the person . when you want something with nonstop metal power , this is the ad to get . the inclusion of an entire separate ep and a bonus track in addition to the original album makes it that much better . this is definitely going to become one of my favorite cos .
ad skips so much in the last 5 songs i had to shut it off . i have not listened to it since .

if you enjoy christmas music , this is as good as it gets ! if you are a george start fan , you will not be let down . the mix of new and classic songs makes for an hour of enjoyable , gather - around - the - fire music . from melancholy merry christmas wherever you are to santas on his way , this album is a perfect addition to your christmas collection . i highly recommend merry christmas strait to you !
always great . i have so much respect for him and his music . loved it .

i love george strait , but both of garth brooks christmas cos blow this one out of the water . i make this point because i am the first to give strait the credit as the best country artist of the the 80s and 90s and not brooks . this ad drags and drags again . it sounds like it was thrown together really quick to meet the season . george sings with no emotion , which is rare , and if i did not no better i would think that he was jewish . i hate to say it , buti play allot of christmas music during the holidays and i no longer even consider this disc . i only keep it for collection reasons .
i read this in one day truly amazing story . it took me on a emotional rollercoaster ! definitely a must read !

sawyer and madison have to be two of my favorite characters . granted i was not happy with some of the things sawyer did , i could understand where he was coming from , especially with his brother whispering all that carp in his ear . madison is one of the strongest female characters i have ever read and i loved her from the start .

i really enjoyed this story . had a mix of emotions . although i think the author could have included a bit more to a few different chapters , i really loved madison and sawyer . i did not want the book to end . hoping there will be a sequel to fill in some missing pieces !

good book . i know times are different . but i guess i just was not brought up to use the language of today . i did enjoy the book except for that . you sure make it sound like all these two did was stay in bed ? nice if it works .

a great love story . it was not just a mushy story . it had so many components and it was emotionally orbiting . there were several times where i cried for the characters . my only regret is that kristy did not get her just dues .
this was a sweet love story , even although it was another guy that can not seem to commit . the storyline was interesting , i really liked the couple .
this book was awesome . i am glad sawyer got over his issues . he is such a great guy . i feel so bad for peyton and madison . they both go through so much .
love madison sawyer and peyton , she deserved happiness . maybe a second book to see what the next part of their lives

madison and sawyer what can i say about them . i fell in love with sawyer from the beginning and madison was the girl that you really wanted to root for from the beginning because life was never easy for her . this was a very well put together story and it keep my attention from the beginning until the end . i loved seeing these two together and the back and forth between them kept me more than wanting to read . this book gave me everything that i needed and more . i look forward to reading more from this author .

i read this book in a day . i could not put it down ! i love sawyers and madison story . you i aime grey could write a whole series of books about their family and friends . just saying and i would read every one of them . great job !

i could not put this down . i want to laugh and cry throughout the book . my heart just broke for madison and all the people that she lost in her short life . however , she also met others who became her family as well . i did not want the book to end . i wanted more of madison , sawyer peyton .

i really enjoyed this story . the blurb caught my attention and i immediately felt that i needed to read it . i loved just about everything . some of it seemed a bit too much , but for the most part it was a really good story , i liked the authors writing style and liked most of the characters . i will definitely read more from this author in the future , i would even like to read more concerning these same characters .

this book has obviously been heavily edited recently . reading through other reviews , i was like what the fuck are they talking about ? ! i do not think i have ever had such rollercoaster emotions while reading no , actually devouring a book . i was less than a percentage in when the tears started . not long after that i was shuffling around in my chair , feeling the sex coursing through me . so many emotions . anger , joy , hope , despair to name a few . i must admit , sawyer is not my favourite leading character . there has a weakness and vulnerability to him that i just can not handle . his loyalty to his big brother in the majority of the book goes beyond bounds . he confused me . i struggled to get a handle on his age . i am assuming closer to 30 , but he had something about him that just led my mind to picture him as a lot younger . i liked the storyline . it was quite predictable but then i guess it would not be a romance if there was not a hea . i really enjoyed the mixed point of view , particularly the little section from olivia . all in all this is a good debut book and i urge those of you read it pre edit to give it another go !

i did not expect that was refreshing . i will try not to reveal too much of said twist but it has to do with madison father and siblings . another aspect i enjoyed were the different perspectives of the characters . i will look forward to more literary works from aime
i loved this story about sawyer , maddison and peyton ! could not put this book down ! so glad no cliffhanger ! great book !

book 3 of a trilogy and yet it is still a self contained book . reading the previous stories do add characters depth and some story line extra information but it is not mandatory to read to enjoy this book . this book has a very nice love story intertwined in the story as well as other action happening all around them . well written and very enjoyable to read . i was gifted a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for an honest review .
i loved that the book keeps you guessing until the end . will she be with the guy that she has always liked ? even although she does not want to admit it ? will she find her dad ? amazing read .

but what an ending it was . i have enjoyed this series immensely and this last book was amazing . pinky and an sexy alpha bear , what can be wrong with that ? pea pays a visit and pinky makes discoveries about her father , while finding herself . can not go wrong with this ending .

i loved it ! once again lilian captured the essence of a great were story . i loved the introduction of new characters , as well as , the new history of old players ; which only helped to enhanced the realism of world in which they live . more more ! gretchen

i loved this installment of the crane curse series , i have loved pinky and rafael since we 1st met them . lilian rhodes does not disappoint with this book . we learn more about the crane curse and some very interesting things are going on in leeds point , we get to learn more about rafael and his life before pinky . pinky learns maybe she has not so normal after all ? this book was steamy hot in parts , sweet and loving and i could not put it down once i started ! bravo lilian rhodes for another amazing book !
i can not get enough of these books . this author is quickly becoming one of my all time favourite authors . every book in this series has rocked my world .
this is a great ending to the series . the story line was great . it keeps you interested in the story and setting on the edge of your seat wondering what will happen next . just loved this book .

pinky scythe loves researching and learning the history of the shapeshifters or witches or and more in this world she sees herself as a simple person , she does not have any powers . now she is challenged to learn more when her father disappears and seems to turn her world upside down . in finding a solution will she find her true purpose and powers ? at the same time , rafael lacroix pursues her as his mate but pinky thinks he is crazy . will she give in to her desires ? i really enjoyed the crane curse series although you could read each as a stand - alone it is more powerful to read all 3 to learn the intricacies of the curse and how everyone interconnects . it is also just great writing by lilian rhodes so jump in and enjoy !
this book was very interesting and i am glad that pinky and rafael was finally able to see there way to each other . i can not wait for the next book .
i loved all three of these books and am so thrilled to read more about pinky and her love really great ending

finally , the story is delightful ! most of my favorite characters from is rhodes novels are here and so many questions are at last answered ! i promise you will enjoy this one . she is wise enough to leave you wanting more . grimm

loved it ! a strong alpha male with a sweet softer side for his mate , who is tough all on her own . together , they are unstoppable and quite adorable as well . i read it in one sitting , finishing just now at almost five am !

i was gifted an arc of this story by the author in exchange for an honest review . i am sad to see the end . i had hoped that the cranes and the strange town of leeds point would go on indefinitely , but alas it is only a trilogy which from the end of the book tells me that a spin off will occur . i enjoyed getting to know the cranes , the various shifters involved and am happy that all ended well . i look forward to a wolf at the door coming sometime this summer 2014 if i remember the title and proper dates my memory just is not what it used to be . i am so glad i joined lilian street team as i enjoyed her style of writing and look forward to more shifter stories , maybe a wolf in a kilt . one can dream right .

yes this is a great ending to the series pinky finally finds her one although she tries to resist him but who could resist the sexy bear shifter rafael pinky searches for her dad and finds him the strangest place the crane curse is finally lifted and it is all good .

pinky is a human with a sensitive and caring personality . she feels responsible for her fathers disappearance and the hole it has i left in her mother and twin siblings lives . she is on a mission to find him , but the local alpha insists she be accompanied . this is raphael and pinky story , which unwinds around a mysterious disappearance and a murderous shifter . while the story can be followed without reading the first two books in the series , i recommend you read them all in order . the crane curse unravels throughout the three books ; you may miss nuances if you only read the last book . it is a great series , and i hope the author will write future books that include this town and characters . i loved the series and do not want to say goodbye to the characters .
a good set of works by one of the last philadelphia age christians . you will not be disappointed with the time spent reading these .

i have just downloaded this book . the toc on the kindle works great , however , the toc does not show up on the kindle for pa . i am not sure why this happens , but i planned to read it on my kindle anyway . i am looking forward to reading this book on my kindle , i have read some of the sections on another device and the content is excellent .
this is the best book that i have found to really understand gods word and to understand what this world and this life is all about .
we have so good writers today but none like brother chaser he takes it off the shelf and explains it were the layman can understand it !

if you have not read lewis sherry chaser you are in for a treat . after reading these books i became a chaser devotee . i bought his eight volume systematic theology and was not disappointed . chasers theology is spot on . he founded the dallas theological seminary in 1924 and was it is president until his death in 1954 . i
excellent reading and life - changing truths presented so clearly ! a must read !

i read lewis sherry chasers exposition of the book of ephesians when i was a baby christian many years ago . it was an inspiration for my young faith , written in a way i could understand . i bought this book to read more , even although i have been a christian for more than 40 years . i am still inspired .
a must read for the serious bible student . the writing is the style of almost 100 years ago , but the message is timeless .

for me , there is no one like dr. chaser , or those who studied under him at dallas theological seminary . his knowledge about satan and grace are unsurpassed . if you want to really understand erwin rutgers books hitlers cross , when a nation forgets god and oprah , miracles , and the new earth , read dr. chasers book satanic motives and methods . it really sheds light on the satanic influence behind all 3 of those books . chasers book grace exposition of gods marvelous gift is a phenomenal explanation of all that gods grace entails . a must read . since they are still under copyright , this does not include his systematic theology or the book major bible themes . these are worth the effort to acquire and read . major bible themes is really a summary of everything else that he wrote .

outstandingly complete and well organized . i just received the 8 volume series only 3 weeks ago so this is a process which should take quite some time as it is a study and not just a read . they used to teach this in the dallas seminary . it is something all who wish to enter the pastor or teacher life should consider . i will try to remember to return a year from now for an actual review .
went to dallas seminary in 1992 and just love to read theology by lewis sherry chaser . this is some of his best works .
these seven books by chaser are each one a classic . even although they are all public domain , it is very convenient to have them all available grouped together in one place like this .

i am completely satisfied with the content of this book , but i see no evidence of the meticulously - built active table of contents mentioned in the book description . since it is a multiple - work collection , it is difficult to navigate without one . updatethe publisher of this book has fixed the problem with the toc and i now have the updated version . it works great . this book is a great value and i can now highly recommend this kindle version .
this book was purchased as a gift . the person was very satisfied with it . the book was exactly as the seller described it . it was delivered before the date promised , and it was packed well .

the 33 eternal positions in grace in the book on salvation , and the book on ephesians are blessings upon blessings . this collected works of chaser takes you to the window sill of heaven . sell your shoes and buy a copy .

first of all , i bought this pos because i thought the song that the album was named after would be on the album . that guy rocco can play ! he just does not do it on this album . besides swing low , every song is the same whiny 14 year old girl is that every other band on the radio sounds like . what a waste of talent . save yourself the money and just listen to any other whiny non - original music that has dominated the rock stations for the past 5 years . i thought i was going to hear a more blues or rock kind of stuff but they are exactly like everyone else .

some amounting most rocco deluca and the burden fans , first heard about them on their vh1 documentary i trust you to kill me which i also recomend you buy , it allows you to understand the music even better and i was extremly impressed by their talent . their ad of the same name is absolutely amazing ! it is been years since i have heard music that has come from such an orginal artistic point of view . every song is beautiful ! i promise if you buy this ad it will be in your ad player for months , you will not be able to stop listening to it !

wow , this is one great ad . do yourself a big favor and buy it now . you can thank me later after you have played it 20 - times in a row and are looking forward to the 21st . original song writing , vocals , musicianship , production cheers to jude cole , song arrangement and red hot single called colorful check out the video on vh1 ! the flow of the ad makes you feel like you just sat through a concert . there are classic rockers like colorful , how fast , gravity and soul mixed with some beautiful acoustic numbers like bus ride and mystified . the majority of the ad is rock . there are a couple of songs that have a blues feel like swing low . rocco deluca dad was a touring guitar player with some of the best blues artists in the business . rocco followed in his footsteps backing up greats like taj mahal , john mall , john lee hooker and johnny cash . needless to say he has been groomed his whole life to do this and it all comes together on this ad .
we watched the vh1 special about them . it was amazing . i immediately purchased the album while watching the show . worth every penny !

fantastic first release from rocco and ironworks . rocco is an amazingly talented musician , songwritersome amountuitarist . i love swing low and i am blown away everytime i listen to soul this track along makes it worth to cost of the ad with rocco amazing guitar work being backed up by jude cole an excellent musician himself on guitar and keyboard . i look forward to hearing more from rocco and ironworks for a long time .

i heard kiefer sutherland promoting rocco deluca and decided to check it out . kiefer , jude cole and their ironworks company have delivered a jewel . this is refreshingly original rock and roll . many other reviewers have talked about how different this ad is from so much of what is being pumped through the airwaves . check out the previews of the tunes and you will want the whole album ! i am hooked !
in a time where music seems to be nothing but cookie cutter music along comes rocco deluca the burden . not only is his music original , he also has a great and powerful voice . a must buy .

i have tried to give this ad a chance because of all the great reviews . i have listened to it in different places , moods , and came back to it again and again hoping that it would grow on me . however , do not buy this edit will be wasted money . it is less than average . i would rather take a chance picking a ad blindly out of a used box of cos . the music is bland at best , has no originality , and i can only conclude that the great reviews are from friends of the band . or as the reviews would suggest , k. s. fans . give yourself and your ears a break not waste your time .

i saw this band perform on one of the late shows , and i was not impressed . however , i purchased the ad , hoping that my first impression was incorrect . it was . rocco and his burden deliver a unique , original album full of songs that are perfect for any situation , be it a party , or just kicking back to relax . they really show their ability in an interesting array of tracks , ranging from twangy and almost country to alternative rock . must - hears on this album are track 4 , bus ride , and track 9 , mystified . fantastic !

thank god music is not dead ; i was beginning to despair that my declining years would be spent in agony listening to dull blasting beats from britney - spear - clones and repetitive violent gangsta - raps . then along comes ironworks music to save the century of new rock ! jude coles delivering rocco into our arms to hold close and savor his heart - felt melodies made me want to weep and dance for joy at the same time real music , to continue singing a kinship to the soul of good people everywhere ! i look forward to more of jude cole , rocco , and ironworks music !

i saw rocco deluca the burden when they opened for robert randolph i the family band , and i was blown away . rocco live show is incredible , i was entranced by every song , and this is atypical because usually , i do not really enjoy performances unless i am at least familiar with the music of the artist . the passion in the performance and the voice of this band blew me away . so i excitedly purchased the ad . after listening to the studio ad , however i was disappointed . the power of the live show of this band did not translate , and the music sounds like something i have heard before , instead something to be excited about . the ad is still very good , and i would suggest buying it , because lyrically it is very mature , and the use of the dobry resonator guitar is very different . some of the highlights include the songs favor , soul , and dope . if you have the opportunity however see them live . then you will see why their first ad is only the beginning .

i really enjoyed hearing a kind of old school sound with a touch of modern edge . rocco voice is what gets me . i love it . i really enjoy the hearty feeling to some of the tracks and how it builds into an explosion of sound . the only downfall to the ad is that it is kinda all over the place with the overall vibe . i felt like he was trying too hard to show all of the stuff he can do .
this is the best music i have heard in a very long time . a refreshing blend of the modern with undertones of blues and other genres of music . well worth the money .

regardless of the hype involving heifer sutherland and late night to appearances for this number , i expect a good album to affect me in a way independent of label or connection . i begrudgingly admit this one does . from the first track on through the entirety , i was surprised by the dexterity of a rather humbly broadcasted ad . the burden and co. are fairly new , but the appeal is broad . it is a breathy mix of coldplay , incubus , and a bit of old word indie sound that makes a good sing along as well as a disc i could excitedly say , threesome amountisten ! without later being embarrassed . none of the songs come off as filler and the variety in melody and approach keep it from being bland or like six bowls of similar musical soup . i would gladly recommend this to someone looking for a mellow experimental sound mixed with tremulous effect and raw talent and bark at them to snatch this up . it is well worth the minutes spent hearing it .

this is one of the best albums i have purchased in the last couple years . the album successfully blends different genres and makes it all work . there has rock , blues , alternative , punk , americana and other genres influencing the sound . thank you ironworks for putting out a band grounded in rock and blues !

after waiting for just over three years for alanis newest record i can say that it was well worth the wait . each song on under rug swept stands solidly on it is own . it seems that as alanis has grown as an artist that she has lost the strained high - pitched moan that came at the end of many of her lyrics on jagged little pill . i praise alanis for such a fantastic piece of work and can not wait to see her on the under rug swept tour .

under rug swept is definitely the best ad of alanis career as of yet . every single song has it is own charm to embrace , and you can listen to them over and over and never get tired of them . alanis strongpoint has always been in her lyrics , and i love to sing along with this ad . my favourite songs are the first four : 21 things that i want in a lover : because it is fun and the lyrics are great , sometimes you even have to laugh . narcissus is cheeky and upbeat . obviously i have to include hands clean , this albums reminiscent single . and flinch , being on the slower side , stills bears a positive message . another good song is surrendering . if you do not have this ad yet , all i can say is that you had better have a good excuse for waiting . this is a must - have !
alanis is my favorite music performer and song writer . i love every ad and recommend them all to anyone who wants to hear the truth , be inspired and heal their heart .

only two words describe this album : sheer brilliance ! . i love each and every song on this album , and there is only one other album that i feel the same about , and that is jagged little pill . this album has the same feel about it as jagged little pill , so for those who loved jagged little pill , i think you will love this album just as much , if not more . this album has everything , from the guitar filled rock of the outstanding 21 things and a man , to the ballads like the deeply moving at that particular time and alanis wish for a better world utopia , and everything in between ! all alanis lovers and even those who have not liked her previous albums , i encourage you to buy this album . sheer brilliance !

alanis has been criticised for using unabridged sentences , and . awkward syntax with . distorted phrases . as any fan will tell you , this is what we love about alanis , the way she will take a simple feeling , alanisise it then throw it back out twisted and reworked so we have to think about her wording to uncover what she means , that is her artistic license that makes her so addictive and unique . do not be put off by supposed former infatuation junkies not so hot reviews , it was not well received , but under rug swept in in some ways a back to basics album with great melodies , thought provoking lyrics that make u smile with recognition of having the same thoughts and feelings in your own past relationships . if you are looking for a reason to come back to alanis , this is it . a fantastic album .

this is truly some of alanis best work . the album hardly has a bad track . each track is a strong as the other , and this was the case with her jagged little pill album . my favourite alanis album is suppossed former infatuation junkie , because alanis was completely original on that record . but under rug swept is definately one of her best so buy it . you will not regret it highlights : 21 things , so unsexy , precious illusions , hands clean , narcissus , a man , u owe me nothing , surrendering , utopia !

even the first time i listened to this album i was hardly impressed . you owe me nothing is the only song that sounded somewhat original and interesting . as for the rest of the album , it is either too pop , or too dull . amazing , although , how the music videos , that were made to promote under rug swept , were still original . whereas with the release of alanis newest ad so called chaos , the videos are cheese judging by alanis music video for everything .

under rug swept is a really amazing disc . morissette has taken production control and created a musical set with complex , sometimes hysterical lyrics and a rhythm focusedsome amountuitar - heavy melody . absent is the frenetic musical experimentation that was supposed former infatuation junkie and in it is place is a more cohesive and structured album . . the angry girl depiction has become such a media and critics cliche . on under rug swept she does not so much rant at men as she describes her own place in these dysfunctional relationships . beautifully written , these songs may sound like stream - of - consciousness poetry , but at least they are thought provoking and delivered with great vocal finesse . it is about style , baby , and morissette hook is the vocal and linguistic game of tag that she plays throughout her songs . ripped vocals and sexy melodies wrap themselves nicely around morissette writing , making this a truly wonderful disc . 21 things i want in a lover , hands clean and you owe me nothing in return are three of her strongest tracks to date and alone make the album worth owning . just check out this album .

i like the album . yup , it has a different style or sound from jagged little pill , but that is part of the fun of following a musicians career . sit backbone amountisten , and enjoy the journey they take us on ! if every album sounded the same , then i would say a musician was not growing .

i really think this is alanis best work , i absolutley loved it ! jap and said where great , but the songs in this album are amazing . her voice , but especially the lyrics are mesmerizing . my favorites are 21 things . , flinch , hands clean , but especially that particular time . other songs like utopia and so unsexy are so very powerfull . i think there isn't a songwriter as great as alanis , my best friend and i love her , we have all of her cos . we just hope that her next studio album does not makes us wait too much . she's definetely a gifted artist !

after hearing the terrific songs so unsexy and hands clean on the radio , i rushed out and bought what i hoped would be a smart , energetic , insightful ad . what i discovered instead was alanis morissette basically recycling the same music she used on her jagged little pill ad . only this time , her lyrics are more obtusesome amounts accessible , and less compelling . there are a few bright spots on the ad , such as the songs i mentioned . but , overall , the ad is rather negligible and self - involved . i believe only die - hard fans of morissette will get any real mileage out of this vapid collection . ironically enough , i purchased lisa lobes new ad cake pie the same day i bought this one , and that ad surprised me by being the musically superior to morissette effort . so if you want some great new chick rock , check out that title .

i am not sure i would suggest this album for those who loved her previous albums but for hard core fans it has it is moments . she used to be my favorite artist until i got this album , it is just not full of her characteristic i hate the world and everyone in it attitude i fell in love with . if you are looking for something more positive an up beat , check this one out ! if not , i would listen to the samples above before spending your money . you never know , you may like it anyhow !

one thing that has surprised me about alanis is that she has maintained her artistic integrity i this is quite a thing to do in an era when we or time or aol regularly makes hit records by profiling songs on smallville . ironically swept is published by warner ! hehe . alanis lyrics are easily understood . her syntax and phrasing are not faulty i in fact her singing is part of a distinctly canadian performance style . our lady peace is a good example . if you want easy listening pick up a logos album . as for her stream - of - consciousness songs , this is something unique and rare . alanis is baring her soul in the way that best fits her own personality . this album deserves five stars . alanis broke the mold with her first album . her newest release proves why she is the most impressive female rocker of the last decades has more consistency , creativity , integrity , and passion .

as with her previous project , alanis has once again shown that she is growing both as an artist and as a person . the angry white female recovering from childhood and a series of bad relationships is perhaps even less present on this album then on the follow - up to jagged little pill . alanis once again delivers with her unique ability to combine melodic riffs and enchanting hooks with powerful lyrics that will stay swiming in your head long after you are done listening . perhaps the only negative is that the stream of consciousness lyrical style is a little difficult to keep up with at times as it has a tendency to babble a bit .

being a long - time alanis morissette fan and after waiting for 3 and 1/2 years for a new studio recording , the first thing i did today was run out and buy her new album . it was definitely worth the wait ! she is an amazing artist and has , once again , proven her worth as an extremely talented musician . her lyrics are poignant , touching and brutally honest . her journey of self - discovery have helped me through some of my most heart - breaking experiences . once again , she has given me a wonderful album of incredible music and gut - wrenching honesty . thanks for sharing yourself with us , alanis ! you are amazing !
good attempt to play classical strings music in modern interpretation of strings music beginners . not so professional music . i can not recommend it for music lovers .
my son turned me onto this group . they are fantastic . i love every song on the album and highly recommend it to everyone . great blend of classical and rock .

this magazine has become my favorite tool for my spiritual awakening . the articles are articulate , heart - felt , and easy to understand . since they only have four issues a year , you have time to reflect upon each article and get the most from the writer . it also gives me time to read over several times and keep finding new things . i have found so much joy in this subscription and now family members are reading , too . this makes for positive conversation at family dinners . there is no political agenda and the magazine speaks of science as well as spirituality , which i think is important . i will be subscribing as long as they keep writing . namaste .
i love this magazine i read it from cover to cover
not happy with this particular type of publication . not at all what i expected and there were some delivery issues .

excellent articles running the spiritual gamut . the variety and rich scope touched all my desires for meaningful dialogue . the thoughts and subjects discussed in my first issue because me to eagerly await the next . i am so looking forward to more articles that will scratch that deep and soulful itch !

i got this as a mothers day gift for my mom last year , and she has asked me for a renewal for this year . she has enjoying all of the articles , and has even gone off and explored several of the topics brought up in the magazine . she has not complained of any filler or excessive ads , and more , so i am counting this one as a win .
light of consciousness is exactly the type of magazine i was searching for . the articles are short , well written and easy to understand . keep up the good work .
i absolutely love this magazine and have for years . i hope to see it never go out of print . worth every penny .

for some time i had been looking for an interfaith spiritual magazine at the level of seekers with some experience . this one is based in hinduism but contains articles on other traditions and evidences religious tolerance . at a certain level of practice and experience the boundaries which divide us are just plain wrong thinking . this magazine would be a good basic education for beginners but also seems challenging enough for a well - worn traveller on the road . it is literate and sophisticated , and the graphics are beautiful and inspiring .
i love this magazine and so happy that amazon carries it . i read it cover to cover when it comes !
great magazine but only received 2 magazines of a years subscription

this is a wonderful magazine . absolutely full of information , very depth . there is no wasted space on these pages ! at the back there is an advertising section that is interesting to look through .

this magazine is full of thoughtful , useful spiritual reflection and advice written by people who are experienced on their own path . it is smart and inspiring , neither overly intellectual nor vapid . everything is well written , and it is nicely put together , too . a unique magazine .
i really like this mag . the stories are diverse and provide some great wisdom and helpful tips . i would recommend it to anyone interested in spirituality .

light of consciousness magazine stands alone in it is field . the satan of swami amar jyoti and articles by authors with different backgrounds take the reader on a journey of discovery . i read each article several times , each time inspired anew . it is a lovely magazine !

i discovered this journal in a news stand at an organic market and found it fascinating throughout . i liked the discussions about vedic as well as buddhist and other philosophies . the articles show the ways in which the ancient wisdom traditions on enlightenment or awakening are closely related . there is just no argument about this , only different words used to describe the same experience . a refreshing read .
just as in my review of vol . one , the only way to release a greatest hits collection from these guys was to do it over six discs like they already did .

10 songs from the last 4 records just is not going to do it . the major flaws here are : 1 the inclusion of the song remains the same and no quarter , which are definitely the strongest or most memorable tracks from houses of the holy 1973 i such as over the hills and far away , the ocean , dancing days , or dyer maker . 2 the inclusion of 10 minute achilles last stand from the weakest record , presence 1976 , could have been replaced with 2 - 3 much better , more memorable songs from other records over the hills and far away , the ocean , dancing days , dyer maker , fool in the rain , or in the evening . save the money from purchasing these two compilations and spend the money on the complete recordings and make your own compilation .

it is true that the ad does not have many great songs like fool in the rain and dancing days , but it is still a great ad . if you buy both the early days and latter days , you might find yourself ignoring this ad completely , so you have to be careful . but just give it a few tries and you will be hooked . note to page or plant or jones : enough boxed sets ! please !

getsome amounts face it . not everyone is a real led zeppelin fan by most of your standards . i , for one , am relatively eclectic in my selection of music . i consider myself a real fan but i do not need absolutely everything they ever released . these compilation cos were the answer to my dilemma as to how to get most perhaps not all of my favorites without having to spend a lot of money all at once . i really enjoy these cos and i would encourage anyone interested to purchase them . after all . a fan is a fan no matter which way you look at it and we are all spending the same color of money .

this one is a bit of a let down after the near perfect programing of the early days comp . surely it would have made more sense to include the best tracks off of houses of the holy and done without 11 minutes of achilles last stand . but , it does provide a good purchasing option , in that it does not seem redundant to buy houses of the holy along with this . the songs from physical graffiti are exactly the ones i would have picked houses of the holy , trampled underfoot , kashmir and the later selections are good enough . i do like achilles last stand . the book of photos is wonderful .

stravinskys music changed the world . this repackaging of the cumbersome multibox set issued previously has been very well done . the performances are unique in that stravinsky conducts all his major works robert craft conducts 1 ad of smaller works extremely well . the sound is incredibly good throughout considering the hatchet jobs columbia records now sony used to bestow on some of their artists in the 1960s . however , that some in that company had the presence of mind to capture these performances for posterity must be thankfully acknowledged . 5 stars for the real thing .

sound is better than ever , if you do not ear difference is a problem of equipement , i already have the original jacket edition and this is superior in soundsome amounting the other people i am in trouble with sony , if you purchase this item , you are a serious collector , why do not ask for more money but give a complete libretto and info , this is the only problem with this edition , do not hesitate in buy these cos , only the ballets cost more in separate cos

this is a great collection of recordings . i am glad that cos columbia had the foresight to have the composer conduct these works before his death . if you are a stravinsky fan , this is the ultimate collection .
as described and wonderful to listen to . excellent customer service . a experience .

if you love stravinsky or the copeland or bartok or shostakovich or and more variant of 20th century music , you must buy this for the sheer price performance . if not , buy it anyway and listen to the pieces in chronological order , progressing to the next piece only when the current piece makes sense to your ear . i skip the [ very early ] symphony in e - flat , and be prepared for a few clunkers . i be ravished .

i really consider this the best deal i have ever gotten on amazon ; i purchased this new for some amount of money this set includes a majority of stravinskys works , and definitely provides the most important ones . more importantly , all of these recordings are conducted by stravinsky himself , which is most definitely a huge plus . the audio quality is great , and of course nothing can be said about the interpretation since they are his own . the price for this many works is astounding , and i highly recommend this to any classical enthusiast .

it is been a very long time since i have waiting for stravinskys ballets by stravinsky , even although i have some very good performances by voulez , einstein and abba . but nothing like original authors direction , the scent of his work beyond formalism of the score . and finally , i made it . and even more ! having a complete box containing the works of stravinsky by stravinsky is a real treasure , by all means . this box set is quite complete , excellent sound and very cheap . only two observations : one , operas and melodramas need lyrics and , two , it would be much better considering some works in it is original languagesome amounting les notes . anyway , excelent job and very convenientsome amounting it a try !

yes , i have strong sympathy for all the reviews which have given five stars rate to this box set herebefore . i bought the same music in mid - line 22 ad luxury box incarnation under the title igor stravinsky the recorded legacy last year . sure the bargain box set edition here offers even more value economically and will benefit more music lovers in the world . you can say nothing except listening to breathlessly when igor stravinsky , as both the composer and the exponent , conducts the performances of almost all his own music , to say nothing of the consistently excellent sound quality , which is especially important to the music of stravinsky . many thanks to sony or cos production team who made not only excellent original recordings but also marvellous ad transfers . a great achievement indeed ! i would also like to recommend everyone stravinskys small but meaningful book poetics of music . it tells you what his attitudes to music are , illuminates further your experience of listening to his music and let us you know why so much influence he has long had on other composers of the world . let us go back to stravinskys music and enjoy it .
this box set is absolutely wonderful ! i enjoy listening to stravinsky conducting his own worksite the ultimate interpretation . i have no complaints .
as a musicologist and music theorist , we are enjoying the historic recordings of these great works . we wish that personnel lists were included , but that is difficult to obtain in these cases .

when columbia cos decided to record all the works of stravinsky conducted by the composer , it became one of the most spoken about ventures during the 60s and 70s . i remember the vinyl box set and how i wished i had the extra money to acquire this set . now sony has remastered the sessions on ad . these are awesome performances of some of the greatest music written in the 20th century .

. but why could not they re - master them ? having just watched jewels by the paris opera ballet on did , i was curious about his carpaccio for piano , which was the first from this set i played . this was the music to rubies , the second of the jewels which was hilarious , exciting , touching , and what else can i say ? very sexy . i was not disappointed . if you are a stravinsky - ite , this set is a must . highly recommended .

previously a full set of all of stravinskys work was well over some amount of money and since that version is out of print , it sells for far more now . where can you get 22 cos of music for some amount of money ? i am thrilled with this set , although there is just one small booklet with very little material in it . a nice plus is that each ad jacket does have the selections listed on the back . it is a cheapo cardboard box and the cos are in paper sleeves , but what can one expect for some amount of money ? if you have always wanted a full set of all stravinskys work without paying through the nose for it , this is the set for you . this set does not always contain the best interpretations of stravinkys work , but most stravinsky fans will buy copies of their favorites as well as owning this complete set . includes some stravinsky rehearsals too , as well as a clip of stravinsky talking about the rite of spring . includes some suites as well as the full work .

this is a staple for anyone owning a stereo and a ad player . it is a learning experience . a bit of an acquired taste , a foreign language that one has to learn , when we only know our own language . it is complex . it is sometimes intellectual . it is moody . it is fascinating from a sound point of view , instrumentation . it is fresh . it is real .

got this for my dad for his birthday . he is a huge fan of stravinskys work ! loves the whole collection and would recommend it to any fan of stravinsky you literally get all of his works famous and not but excellent selection . sound quality is amazing no static at all ! definitely would recommend .

i snagged this as a freebie from amazon because the cover looked interesting . i started it and finished it in one sitting . the storyline immediately drew me and i had to know the whole story . julia better known as jewel is the start performer at rapture hosting a duo with her bestfriend victor once a month . ten thousand dollars for one night of sex with a gay man ? what could be easier ? that is until victor moves away to live his dream . heading into work she finds out there has a been a change of plans to schedule and she will be paired with the ripper . the strange name draws her in and gives her worry . their first night on stage is explosive to say the least . cole , the ripper has a darker secret that you have to read and follow to find out . every moment is played out and eventually all demons come out of the closet . this is a fresh storyline that draws you in the moment you see the cover . i was blown away with how well written and descriptive this story was and will definitely be adding more of megan to my collection .

great good fun in the days when napoleon appeared to be on the straight road to the domination of europe . duval is a likeable hero of dry with and increasingly discerning detecting talents . although i have only read three books in the series , they cover the beginning , middle and apparent end of the heros fifteen - to - twenty year policing career . the author is filling in the missing years and adventures at her own pace , and at random , so it will pay to keep checking back to see when duval will appear again , with another well - researched tale of adventure and daring - do .

this was a well - written book , with a very likeable hero . i prefer historical fiction , and this book delivers ! i also appreciate the absence offensive language and explicit sex . ms. mcgrath has another devotee , and i look forward to enjoying more of her work .

set in post - revolutionary france , duval and the infernal machine captures the atmosphere of suspicion and intrigue that reigned in paris at the time . the author does a splendid job of immersing the reader into the darker corners of the city . i am hoping that this is the first in a series of many duval novels , as the protagonist is spa and at the same time very human .
a reasonable story about the secret police that were charged with ferreting out the enemies of napoleon bonaparte with a love affair mixed in .
interesting characters with a good blend of historical and fictional . set in france during a very volatile historical period . plot and story flow nicely and plausibly .
this was a quick read in an authentic voice that brought the characters and settings to life . would like to read more from this author .
i found at first i wondered why i was reading this book , and then i was caught up in it and quite enjoyed it .
this book has a little romance and crime mystery . it is a quick read . but maybe too quick . i feel there are parts that could have been developed more . i did enjoy the story .
duval is a young wounded war veteran who becomes involved as a detective with the paris police . the story has moments of intrigue and some poignant scenes of paris in the 1800s .

this is the third of michele maths novels that has found it is way to my kindle . as always a well told and atmospheric story . set in paris during napoleons rule , we find how ex - soldier duval , copes with his new job , corruption finding love in the big city . historical titbits are woven seamlessly into this entertaining story . great read !

there has something nice about a mystery that surrounds historical characters . this book delivers . there has lots of intrigue and the main character is believable with a well developed story line . you will not be disappointed in this book . it is a good one .

i was hooked from the very first page ! the characters where so real and the story telling was so fluid . i did not want to put it down . i gave it only four stars because i felt like the ending was very abrupt . i thought the story was going to take on a new twist and then i was at the epilogue
well written . good , character development but not over done . felt like i was back on the streets of paris after the revolution i would recommend to anyone that likes historical novels

i loved reading his input , i love the series .
very well done . i loved reading garrets point of view .
i have never been one to re - read a book in another perspective , but i am so glad i took a chance on this one . keep them coming !

so i finished the first book pretty late and tried to sleep afterwards . except that was pretty much impossible , and i ended up having to grab this one and get little to no sleep . this is everything that happened in choosing you , but from garrets point of view . if you have read the first book , then you already know he has pretty freaking awesome . getting to see the story told from his perspective really just helped me love him more than i already did . the biggest issue is that there is a lot of repetitious story line . sometimes it felt like she just copied and pasted paragraphs from jades point of view but changed the name to garret . although there are some new scenes , and those were definitely worth the read . i think it would be pretty awesome to read more of the storyline this way although .

really enjoyed garrets point of view . it was a little hard to remember specific details from choosing you since it is been so long . i should have re read it first . nonetheless , it was a great addition to the series . i want a garret point of view for every book now ! loved finding us in the dual point of view .
all the jade series books are great . i love that now i understand garret more . can not wait till the next jade series book comes out !
