i am a bluegrass banjo fan and i found this ad to be pretty good . kinda weird . but pretty good . roy proves himself to be a master with his hard driving banjo style particularly the double banjo pieces with trent . however , some songs have drums and even keyboards , which , when coupled with banjo , yield a bizarre ragtime sound . i do not want to sound like the bluegrass police or anything , but some stuff on this ad like beerbarrel polka are definitely not bluegrass . still , it is well worth listening to .
it you like upbeat banjo , this is for you .

nothing against tony trischkas double banjo bluegrass spectacular , but if you are really looking to explore the potential of bluegrass tunes being three - finger picked in unison , this is the ad for you . i have always been lukewarm about roy clark , wondering why on earth did hee haw showcase roy clark when they had melodic - style originator bobby thompson around ? , but this ad changed my mind about him . neither roy or buck have a reputation as innovators , but when i found out that this album first came out in 1978 , i have to concede that it was well ahead of it is time . while it may have been jarring for bluegrass purists then , it is wonderfully mainstream now , thanks in part to the banjo stream being widened considerably by the subsequent explorations of tony trisha and bela fleck .

although i enjoy bluegrass and banjo music i found these instrumental tracks to be boring and dull . maybe , that is just me as i would prefer singing along with the music . the talent of the musicians is amazing and perhaps this is more of an album for actual musicians rather than someone who listens to it in the car . i remember roy clark from hee haw and that is why i bought it , truly a talented man . the quality of the ad is great just the instrumentals i did not like .
anything roy clark is connected with is always fine . i had the privilege of meeting roy at flatter beach with his daughter and he is fantastic .

i love roy clark from hee haw and this ad introduced me to more great banjo hits . i wish i had known there was not any singing on this disc but it is still worth it none the less . also i wish there was more info other than a title list inside . i buy cos for more than just the music i like to read about the artists and songs .

the person who invented the banjo never would have dreamed it could be played like this ! these guys are amazing , if everyone could play banjo like this , the world would be at peace . i do not know how , but i am sure it would . even people who dislike the sound of banjos would love this ad , just because of the pure excellence of it . buy this ad now , there is not a bad song on it .

this was roy and bucks second banjo album . the first was a pair of 5s . which needs to be released on ad . i felt it was a better album . this is alright . the highlight of the ad is beer barrel polka which is generally associated with accordion music . and these guys have about as much to do with polka as weird al has with country . but they pull it off . being an instrumental ad although . nothing else really stands out to me . and all these songs kind of sound the same . i do feel like i said before that their other album should be released on ad . really i think that all of roy clarks records should be released on ad . at least all of his stuff from the 70s .

i bought this album when it was available on vinyl and have listened to it over the years . i enjoyed it enough that i bought the ad version to play in my car . the fact that i still enjoy it after all these years , is the best recommendation i can give . anyone who remembers hee haw , and enjoyed roy clark and buck trents banjo work on that program , should enjoy this album . if anything , the quality of musicianship is even better on this album than it was on the to show .

roy clark is the man with fast fingers . he is a top notch musician and is always enjoyable to hear . i assume the other person plays fiddle and does a good job . there are no liner notes to enlighten the listener about the musicians , music or studio . that info would make this ad more enjoyable .
this is a great banjo album . how roy and buck can play that fast and in unison is a mystery to me . if you like 5 string banjo , this is a good album .
a great ad ! complements the movie and showcases hugs impressive singing ability .
i really enjoy listening to huge and drew on this ad . i think they should have done more singing together and their movie together was great .

not only did i love the movie , but i also loved this soundtrack ! if you loved the movie , you will love the soundtrack , because this soundtrack captures the essence of this movie . hugh grant and drew barrymore have great voices ! they had the perfect chemistry in the movie ! you will remember the movie by just listening to all the songs on the soundtrack . it will take you back to how you felt after you left the theater after seeing this movie . nothing is missing on this soundtrack !
if you enjoyed the movie , you will be very happy with this ad .
hugh grant and drew are just perfect singers and songwriters . they could do this insted of acting if they got tired .
this ad is one of my favorites ever ! the artist compilation is awesome . drew and hugh can sing a tune

i loved the movie except the parts focusing on the buddha and on the teen girls singing . i thought that was a bad influence on real world teens , and on children . the rest of the movie was fantastic although . it is great to see hugh grant in a slightly different role than usual and he was very funny as a pop star .
i love that this ad has all the songs off of the video including way back into love with drew barrymore and hugh grant , which is my favorite !
i love this ad . the music is actually even better than i thought it would be . i highly recommend it !
hugh grant makes this ad . it is a great companion to the movie .
i love this movie . it is cheesy and campy and reminds me of the 80s i grew up in . the actors are light - hearted and do not take themselves seriously . so fun !
wow this little girl is talented , blows other 20 something stars away . can not wait to see where her career will go .

after seeing the movie in theaters with my sister , the songs were stuck in both of our heads for days after . they are not those annoying songs that you just can not get out of your head , but the kind you never want to leave . the main song a way back into love is sweet and romantic without being overly so , while the songs by haley bennet are a poignant twist on the songs done by early britney and christina although i personally love buddhas delight as a regular song . this ad is a definite must buy , but make sure you go see the movie as well .

the best chick flick ever would not be complete without this brilliant , sentimental , and hilarious soundtrack . this work contains everything a listener could want from the film , the best chick flick ever .

if you watch the movie , you will love the soundtrack . the songs are so funny . all the songs are mostly pop and 80s pop . you can definitely sing too . there are no high notes or low notes . it gets boring fast but hey , it is really funny .

this album is so christmas ! i love it . it also has some wonderful music that is traditionally german that i was unfamiliar with until i heard schmidt arrangements . sussed de locked is fantastic . i also love his arrangements of bring a torch . and i saw three ships . two of the funnest pieces on the album . christmas medley is an excellent combination of what child is this , we three kings which never sounded better than it does here , and carol of the bells . where you there and stars were gleaming are two very beautiful pieces that many may not have heard before , beautifully arranged here .
you simply can not go wrong purchasing any of jon schmidt music ! his stuff is inspirational , moving , spiritual , wonderful ! buy and enjoy !

this by far is my favorite jon schmidt album , and one of my favorite christmas albums of all time . if you like fresh aire christmas albums , you will love this . each song is so melodious and perfectly written to bring out the christmas spirit , which is does so extremely well . these songs take on a new , refreshing life in this album , and it just plain soothes the soul and makes you feel good all over , wishing that christmas would never end . the time and effort jon put into this album makes this a christmas classic for years to come , for young and old alike , and leaves me hoping that another christmas jon schmidt ad follows soon .

this is my favorite christmas album ! it is so beautiful that i gave it as a gift to many friends several years ago . the music is timeless , and i enjoy playing it throughout the year . a very peaceful , calming album .

this is one of those great christmas albums that is perfect for listening to when driving around looking at christmas lights , or while enjoying your own christmas tree , or baking christmas goodies , or . well , you get the idea . jon schmidt has added his flair to some christmas classics , and the result is nice , calming , touching christmas music . got to love it .

the music on this ad encapsulates the christmas spirit while having a nice blend of familiar tunes and less familiar ones . i also enjoyed getting the sheet music and playing these songs myself during christmas time . my parents loved it too .
i love the dumb song i can not believe jon was only 15 when he wrote it . this ad helps me relax when i drive
i own much christmas music , but jon schmidt music is far above the rest . it is positively ethereal ! he is inspired and inspiring !

this album makes christmas for me and my family every year ! it has a wonderfully peaceful feel and bring an amazing mood into our home every year . this is definitely my favorite christmas music and my family and i look forward to listening to it each year .
this is another great christmas album worth buying . my son loves i saw three ships . i remember this song from when i was young but it never sounded anything like this one does .
we love playing this album at christmastime . even my five year old recognizes i saw three ships and gets excited to hear it . this music creates the perfect ambiance .

an excellent ad . i enjoy listening to it as background to those busy christmas prep days that i wish would slow down . it is pleasant and calming . jon combines a few of his own creations with a few traditional christmas melodies . his arrangements of i saw three ships and were you there ? and bring a torch , janette isabella are my favorite arrangements of any out there .

i very much enjoy listening to this album . it is great for background music during christmas festivities . i like the fact that it has several more unusual christmas songs in it which reduces redundancy in my christmas playlist .

i own every one of jon schmidt cos and every one of his piano books . jon schmidt music takes you on a rollercoaster ride of emotions . you can be laughing at his bumblebee song one minute and trying to see through your tears the next . for anyone who likes new - age music that is very inspiring and uplifting i would highly recommend any of sons music .

i have a lot of christmas music . from choirs , to vocal solos to orchestras and so on . this ad is near the top of the list . it is one of my favorites to listen to at christmas time . when i pull out the christmas music every year it is the 1st one i listen to . it is perfect to start the season with and for me listening to it marks the beginning of the christmas season . jon makes these christmas melodies exciting and fresh and yet there is a simple , beautiful tone and quality to them . add in a few of his own creations and you have one of the best christmas cos ever .
a bit of a lack of information , but still it was very good . they show the list of ingredients , when to take , and what to do after those 10 day . do not regret buying it .

had this book years ago , and got rid of it . the diet does work , but i can not remember how well other than a lot of mucous coming out of the body . i do not think i lost more than a couple of pounds . also i only tried the diet once . this book is hard to find might be a collectors item .
not what i expected . did not even give good instructions on the exact formula of the lemonade . wish it would describe it better .

i cleanse regularly for health reasons . i feel lighter and younger in the end . my skin glows and my body runs like a well tuned machine . highly recommend .

i noticed many web sites add extraneous instructions , including prep and post - diet rules . i am glad i decided to buy the original . the diet itself is wonderful . as a first time , i followed the ten day instructions . i lost weight , feel better and it lowered my blood pressure . my sister is an outdoorsman who has asthma . as she was finishing her ten days , she said she walks easier and rests less .
i did this years ago . it worked great for me .

life changing . i have done a 15 - day cleanse in the past and am now doing a longer one . this protocol will leave you feeling better than you likely have in a long time . i felt lighter with more energy and mental clarity from the detox effects . the weight loss is a nice side effect , too . the book gives clear direction and great information to lead to a healthier you ! it is a short , quick read as well , and is written in layman's terms .
this recipe has helped me a lot ! i have found the process very useful for my body . it is amazing the way it changes .

not as consistently excellent as the long black veil , but buy this album for three great songs : the lowlands of holland natalie merchant uses her beautiful voice with great subtlety , i know my love the corps version is irresistible ; the lead vocal is reminiscent of debbie harry on some of blondies most upbeat songs , and raglan road joan osborne voice can break your heart , and it is just as devastating here as on the best songs from relish . a ad with three great songs is better than one with twelve good ones ! the rest of the album is fun to listen to , but not memorable .
what a waste of money ! the whole ad is a disappointment . the songs all lack emotion , and the singers do not perform at their best . this is certainly one to pass up .
such deep emotion , such a unique blending of styles . such innovation from a talented band of old guys . my only complaint is that they do not put out more albums .

it is easy to get overloaded on the chieftains i they have recorded so much that i sometimes start to think of them as part of the grand museum of irish culture , but then i listen , and it is always fresh . this is a very polished band that has the gift of sounding spontaneous see beausoleil for a cajun equivalent . here are a bunch of sad songs sung by women singers who have made reputations in rock or folk or country , not necessarily irish sinead connor being an exception . it is very well done on the whole , with the lower womens voices doing particularly well . bonnie raita and joan osborne do tremendous jobs , the latter with a raglan road that would be too slow if it was not so good . joni mitchell is powerful in the magdalene laundries , and bissel and sinead also do well . sounding a bit fragile vocally , but still effective , are natalie merchant and lorena mckenzie . one disappointment is diana calls danny boy . it is too breathy and there are semi - garland effects that i do not care for . it is a great melody i just let it flow !
this is a very poor effort . does not rate a second listening .

i love the chieftains and was really looking forward to hearing this ad . while it is good , i was a bit disappointed with it too . the songs individually are fine , but the general tone of the album is too slow and somber . i feel it needs more variety . as i listen to it from start to finish , i find myself getting a bit depressed by it . some highlights are saki in the jar , the madeline laundries and the long instrumental set the fiddling ladies . remember although that i am judging this against the standards of other chieftains albums which is a very high standard indeed . if you are seeking an introduction to their music , i would suggest the long black veil . or an irish evening

i will start off by saying that i dig the fact that these guys after performing for 40 - odd years together are still looking for new ways to express themselves . they refuse to be a cliche or to stagnate . i just saw them here in reno this past weekend and while it felt a little sad to not have derek bell and martin fay up there , they still played with great energy and passion . those guys never mail it in . having said that , this one was not my favorite . i felt many of the tunes were a little slow and one - note . i just could not get passionate about their efforts here . it felt a little flat . the real spunk came from the corps who play a lively and fresh version of i know my love and sake in the jar had real wit . never give all the heart a song and word rendition of the yeats poem was haunting . so i guess you could say some of the parts were truly brilliant it is the chieftains after all ! but the whole just never quite clicked for me .
a fantastic collection of songs , female singers and the talent of the chieftains . this is six star stuff .

this piece is haunting and beautiful . the collaboration of the chieftains and multiple female artists from around the world is so pleasing and mesmerising , i felt transported to another place and time .
how can one not like a chieftains album .

words can not describe how terrible this album is . i bought it for a version of raglan road , and there is one good song of about 10 minutes that is a great classic fiddle and guitar jam , but the rest is down right depressing and awful music . some of the lyrics talk of fathers raping their daughters . not your traditional irish and chieftains music to say the least . stay away .

this effort by the chieftains is joyless . it is aptly named for it will surely depress you . we listened to it once and never took it out again . in fact , this is a good reminder to myself to throw it out .

i bought this for the diana krill cover of danny boy and that cut alone has proven to be worth twice the price . i hard to get through the song without moist eyes . but i was very pleasantly surprised and rewarded by most of the other pieces . although i have never been a huge joni mitchell fan , her magdalene laundries is quite nice . factory girl by sinead conner is mesmerizing . but joan osborne was really the surprise for me . i had seen her on to a few times and never took much notice but her angelic voice on raglan road blew me away . on the strength of that , i ordered relish and righteous love and have not been disappointed . i warning : osborne will sound like many different women ! it is uncanny !
the chieftains do it again with their incredible collaborations with many of the worlds outstanding women singers . loved every minute of this ad .

the 2nd story in the barrel family . i am still determined to read the rest of the series . hope you will give them a chance as well . i love it when i can finish a story i a series of stories and sigh happily knowing that it ended happily . if only all our personal stories could end in such a way . thanks to all the romance writers who give us these stories to help get through the ups and downs of our ordinary lives .

loved the story massimo sounds like you could just fall in love with him because of his quiet demeanor , and kelly really needed this vacation and her new love good story to read can not wait for the next .

as with the other books in this series it was a great love story about happy ever after meeting your prince charming and figuring out how to make differences work and building trust when you past haunts keep intruding on you feeling . how to over come those and see what is in front of you the entire time . how listening to you gut instead of other shows you the road to take and admitting when your wrong allows you to find your love and happiness .

i enjoyed honeymoon with a prince . nicole dunham writes a fast paced , interesting book . her characters are intelligent the women have their own style and usually their own business and are not so fluffy that they are not believable . ms. dunham makes the characters come alive and i like them the story is wishful thinking but you think just maybe this could be real ! thanks for writing such a thoughtful story .

first , i do not care if you are a prince . if you were a man , you do not just walk away when a women just just had sex with all night , is dealing with the police and getting arrested . second , the women is a weak door mat who allows men to walk all over her . you forgave for walking away , you were in jail . does she have any pride , no she just wants to have sex with him again . third how stupid are you . i hate reading stupid b.s . you say she is a smart business women . any dumb person knows when you call off the wedding , you take your money and make sure they can not touch it . you want me to believe she continued to have a joint account with him and she put all her money in the joint account and not her back up account . why do you make women look stupid , that whole mess was completely unbelievable . i stopped reading at that point . do not recommend , do not waste your money . this book gives women a bad name . so stupid .

the second book in the series and i have to say that i enjoyed this book as much as the first one . this book is a story of a scorned woman who finds her fiance with her best friend just before the wedding ouch kelly chase decides she will go on the honeymoon solo ; after all she paid for the wedding , honey moon and everything that the couple did . on her solo honeymoon she met a handsome man at the breathtaking mediterranean island of sarcaccia . when the ex - fiance took control of her bank account and canceled all her cards , she was in serious trouble with the hotel . prince massimo barrel has just returned from combat and needs privacy and time to heal . the beautiful kelly intrigues him and he likes the idea that she does not know who he is . he is liked for himself and not his place in the royal family . thank god massimo rescues kelly and bails her out . but , when she finds out who he is , she feels betrayed again by a man and she feels she must walk away . take this journey with massimo and kelly as she works at the royal palace , only to repay massimo .
this book is thoroughly enjoyable therefore i highly recommend reading this sweet story with a feel good ending . karen b.

i typically do not listen to entire cos through in their entirety , since i inevitably get bored with a song and skip through the album . this cave album , however , is one of only a handful of albums that i listen to in it is entirety . every song is a little different , but the feel is familiar and , assuming you like their music , rockin .

i saw cave live with daughter and limehouse on may 4th , 2010 . wow ! cave blew me away . casey has a killer voice and stage presence . i loved them so much i went right out and bought the ad . now it is one of my favorites and i am looking forward to their sophomore ad .

i have been a fan of cave for quite some time . this ad is more than i expected ! my little secret is my favorite song but all songs are incredible . it is a definite must for your music collection ! not only are they amazing live but they are the nicest and most gracious people i have ever met !

i would been hearing champagne throughout the summer on rock radio . i saw the video on fuse a couple of times as well and found myself singing or humming or whistling the hook all the time . on a whim , i checked out caves myspace page and listened to a couple more of the songs . i randomly decided to pick up this disc one day , and i am i ever glad i did . cave blends some great rock hooks , with solid lyrics , and a sound that would fit on rock or pop or rock radio . the tracks champagne , let it go , cry wolf , ghost and little secret are all excellent tunes . i also enjoy beautiful and we all fall down . i think touring with daughter is a great move for them , too . while all of daughter's fans are not necessarily rock fans , cave has enough of a radio - friendly tone to their music to appeal to a wide variety of fans . if you like daughter , t.o.a.d. , shakedown , hinder , or three days grace , cave is right up your alley .

the album arrived 2 days later than it should have being that it was a prime item with 2 day shipping . so since it was a christmas gift that i needed by the date it was supose to arrive and did not , my friend did not get there gift till after christmas . very disappointing . album was new and packaging was fine .

bravo , to cave ! this album is a must have for your collection . champagne is one seriously jamming tune . let it go is very good as well , and was used in the newest transformers movie . but , in my opinion , this whole album is kick - ass . one of the best albums of the year !

if you buy this because of champagne , you may be disappointed . i expected a harder edge to the disc . to each his own , although . i am not surprised to hear they opened for daughter as they have a similar style overall . if you like that , you might not be disappointed . i was hoping for more of a sick puppies , whose you are going down was more exemplitive of the overall tone of their ad tri - polar .

really good ad . if you like hard rock , this is it ! they are new to the scene , and show their youth by singing abd playing with all they got . saw them in concert , too and they put on a fabulous show !

cave is completely new to me and after listening to let it go , had to listen to these guys . quite simple , much talentsome amountreat music for a couple of listens , not perfect but a tremendously well crafted debut . will not get into details with songs as i liked them all . great sound and melodies , amazing voice as well . cry wolf is one of the best melodic songs here , very recommended . !

with their first major release with warner bro./ reprise , cave is setting themselves up for a bright future . their first song from the album , champagne , is worth the price for admission alone . let it go , from the transformers 2 soundtrack may sound more familiar to some , but champagne will stay with you much long . the album is produced by david endeth of breaking benjamin and paramour fame and has a very modern feel . other songs of note are cry wolf , we all fall down and the song ghost which was co - written by zac melody of the nixon . from st. louis , the band is made up of casey walker lead singer , chad larry drummer , chris hobbs guitarist and brian smith bassist . if you are looking for a new and upcoming band , check out cave . better yet , if you get a chance to check them out live ; do so . their melodies and catchy lyrics will drag you and in and their on stage energy especially brian smith will hook you .

raleigh donovan is left to raise her younger sister after her grandmothers death . she is confronted by , jackson maynard , a death dealer from the kingdom of camera , that was sent to procure her . it took me a couple of chapters to get into the story . after that , this is a book that gets more exciting as you continue to read it . raleigh is a compelling heroine . i like that she does not buy into things easily and needs to be convinced . she is strong and intelligent . she undergoes a lot of changes but handles it with grace . jackson is a worthy prince and heir to the throne of camera . i appreciate that he thinks for himself and follows his instincts , even if it could be costly to him . he is selfless and intelligent . reluctant prince is an exhilarating story packed with action and mystery . dani - lyn alexander created an intriguing world , rich with detail . i really enjoyed this story and look forward to the next book in the series . complimentary copy provided by publisher via netgalley in exchange for an honest review .

a great novel for fantasy lovers everywhere . as an independent reviewer for paranormal books and authors that rock , i thoroughly enjoyed the world created by this author . her fight scenes are exhilarating , her characters are real , and the twists and turns of the plot kept me reading straight to the very end . a book that would be perfect for any age , this is one that will be on my shelf to read to my grandchildren as they grow to love magic worlds the way their parents and i already do ! definitely a five fang book !

what a great story . i loved it ! coming from someone who rarely reads fantasy , that says a lot . can not wait for the next book which for me is the worst part . waiting for the next book . i also want to say that the cover is super cool . loved it !

wow , what a book ! i just finished it and my heart is still racing ! once the action started , it just kept building and building , until i was completely swept away ! it was one of those books where it suddenly reached the end and you are saying out loud , no ! i really wish it had not ended when it did , cuz it left me with questions i wanted answered right now ! guess i have to wait and get the next book and i will be doing so ! i adored this fantasy action love story . the main characters and many of the secondary characters were so incredibly interesting and lovable . the plot was unbelievably amazing ! it was so creative , ingenious , full of great action and a wonderful love story . i could go into some of the plot , but there is just so much to describe and discover , that i will leave that up to you to read and love ! this was one of the best books i have ever read in this genre and i strongly suggest you go pick up this book immediately ! incredible book ! very highly recommended ! 5 blazing stars ! this book was given to me by netgalley in exchange for an honest review .

but i did not enjoy this book . halfway through i wanted to stop reading but my need to finish any book i start made me power through it . what did not i like ? the now - standard insta - love . flat characters . the confusing writing . there were several times that i had to re - read a passage several times to figure out what it said . the number of times the word cocky was used . the very obviously bad bad - guy . i kept wondering how thick the main characters could be to not see what was made so obvious .

for some reason it took me longer to read this book . i think part of it was because i was ok stopping which is rare . this book was very fast - paced . the storyline kept moving and moving . i liked it although because it was different than a lot of other books that i liked . i really liked how raleigh was spelt . also there was not a lot of freaking out on her end about the situation . i hate the required 10 - page freak out about the situation . i really appreciated the relationship that she has with her sister . i really wanted more from the relationship between jackson and raleigh . there were very few moments between them and i think it would be important to see more of their relationship . there was some world - building in this book , but nothing too confusing . i think it would have been helpful to talk more about what makes jackson different or the people in this other realm special . this book was all about not wasting time which i liked . i hate time - wasting in this book . there will be a sequel so i am so excited for it ! note : i received a free copy of this book in return for an honest review !
the writing here needs some refinement but the story is well thought out and enjoyable . characters were likeable and believable .

i am learning to love this authors writing . i liked the world that the author built . i liked the love story between the mes . i liked that the feelings for each other was built up slowly . the only thing i did not care for was the many different characters the author introduced in the book . this can get confusing for me . i have to say that it was well do although . i hope there is a sequel to this world , i would love to return to it .

the characters were so well developed and realistic . this is not a story of insta - love . kudos has a deep shame of his attraction to veil ; who happens to be a 20yro male prostitute . the development of their relationship was gradual and realistic . the supporting characters were great additions to the story . the sex scenes are well written and well placed in the story . i do not want to give any spoilers away . so i will simply say that the themes of the story cover topics such as homosexuality in religious beliefs and religious culture to the consequences of shaming and prejudices . the author clearly gets her opinions across without being disrespectful to those who have different opinions . this book deserves a 5 stars rating . bow , rape is alluded to and implied at certain times in the story . however , the author does not go into explicit details describing rape .

i like stories with animals , especially dogs and the authors description of dandy is so clear that i always have a visual representation before me . the story was intriguing because the dandy used only his dog sense without any senses enhanced by trying to make him into a human , just plain common dog sense and that was endearing enough to me . dogs have such keen intelligence and this was demonstrated . it is a short story and just the thing to put a smile on your face before sleep comes .
this is the second short story by m. locke that i have read . as before i enjoyed it and plan to read more .
the dog sniffs out a mystery . i hope the author writes more stories in 19th century san francisco . she is a good storyteller and the host primal aspect seems so real .

the writing was ok , setting and time period cute , but i found it irritating that this and others were a fragment of story instead of a novel and were not clearly marked as short stories . will not buy any more from this author , on principle .

it was an interesting read but the author made it as a very short read . why ? the boston terriers personality fit in well with the authors work . no doubt the author must have pets . it would take the authors instinct and knowledge of pets to initiate this short read . thank you .

a wonderful short story set in the turn of the century san francisco . has wonderful characters and plot . these characters are also in her first book of a series set during that time . i am currently reading her book maids of misfortune in the series . i truly look forward to her next book .
liked all of i i locked storie in this series .
with all of mills san francisco books . love that citygood readsinteresting history woven into good story lines
great complimentary story to the boxed set of victorian san francisco stories . would definitely recommend if you like victorian mysteries .
what a great short story ! dandy shows his depth and ability to care for other canines as well as humans in a most gentledogly manner !
really enjoyed the one novel of is locks i have read . this is a short story . do not bother . i will stick to the novels and hope they are not this transparent .

i finished about the last quarter of uneasy spirits , as well as the misses muffet mend a marriage , and dandy detects in the same evening . i was taken back to the magic of just one more story and thoroughly enjoyed each one up to the last word .

not quite country , not quite pop but quite good . not sure why she has gotten so much hype compared to other artists that are her equal and remain unknown - good agent i guess . but it is a fine album .

i have recently heard gift merrit on gas and fell in love with her immediately . she is the epitome of what it means to be a singer or songwriter . her music and lyrics can be as diverse as her voice . i have read some reviews and from what i have seen , people try to compare her to everyone else . do not do that . listen to her music as if it is the first time you have ever heard a sound . judge her then , not after you have heard someone you think she should sound like . i urge you to pick up tambourine and her first album as well , bramble rose . each ad is completely and utterly different from the next and you will not be disappointed .

gift merritt second album tambourine was well worth the wait . i was impressed with her debut album , bramble rose . unfortunately , that album never really found an audience . this album is just as good , if not better . i find the sound on this album is more evolved , and overall just pleasant from start to finish . there has a lot more uptempo material here , but still brilliant lyrical moments that are poignant and touching . the album starts off strongly with the opening track

this is the first album of gift i have heard . i bought it because they played her song good hearted man in to and i immediately fell in love with that song . it sounds quite like the older pop song all i really need is just a soul man or however the title was . the album was a surprise . a wonderful voice , fast rhythmssome amounted melodies enjoyed it very much . i can only recommend it .

i first heard good hearted man on knot in new braunfels to and thought gift sounded a lot like emmylou harris which is a compliment to be sure , although the song did not impress me all that much . it was not until i heard write my ticket that i realized her depth as a songwriter . i am a sucker for a good redemption song , and ticket gets to me like delbert clintons cover of the otis redding classic dreams to remember , and that is about as good as it gets . i bought the ad and the rest is history . ms. merritt has talent , both as a performer and songwriter , and that is a rarity in this day and age . she has destined for bigger things than americana radio , and good for her .

maybe it is that i discovered gift by way of bramble rose , but i have to agree with moose of many waters review above ; she has a talented artist but this is not the album that is going to get her to stardom . it hearkens back too much to dusty springfield without ever giving us a reason to think she has found her own voice here . that is not to say this album does not have it is moments , but nothing here demands your attention the way trouble over me did on her previous album . if anything , too much money has been spent on this album ; she would be better served to go back to more intimate productions , perhaps a la willie nelsons red - headed stranger .

this second ad by gift surpasses even the best of other female singer or songwriters like carole king and shania twain , who deserving had albums that were a huge commercial success . tambourine is great from top to bottom and the last 5 songs are as good as it gets . to fully appreciate her superb songwriting , one needs to listen and read along with the lyrics a couple of times . her songs combine sensible lyrics with excellent melodies that cover the whole spectrum of tempo . it is hard to pin her down to one genre , but this album deserved more that just the grammy nomination that it got . i do not see how every review could not give it 5 stars !

let me start off by saying that i expected this album to be goodfor stars good . i am not a fan of country music , however , and that made me hesitant to try gifts music . after listening to samples on amazon i was contemplating buying it and then i heard stray paper on the radio and that tipped the scales towards buy ! i am glad i did , the ad is amazing and i am now looking to buy her debut , bramble rose . if you like this , i recommend gemma hayes and rachael yamagata as wealthy are similar , but not the same and each has unique talents that make their music really great .

very good set . ms. merritt grows on you like a mint julia or two . it takes listening to more than once to convince one how good she is . it is never fair to compare one singer to another . however , i get a dusty springfield vibe here . and that is simply great ! until the classic that i know is soon to come is released , this album ad will do quite well thank you .

gift rocks out on this album ! i immediately loved wait it out and late night pilgrim , but i have come to love the entire album . this is one of those albums that i have played front to back , repeatedly , for days and weeks on end . i caught her live at scuba chicagofabulous live show . her opening act , nora connor , was also excellentless rock and more country , but excellent all the way around .

good stuffblues - rock that is energetic , has horns what song is not better with horns ! ? ! , and translates well into gifts energetic live show . a few other reviewers have mentioned the couple of sheryl crow knock - off songs as being too poppy and knocking this album down a notch . that is fair criticism , but sheryl crow also wishes she could make an album that rocks like this !

again , gift merritt delivers some great sounds . the combination of her sweet voice coupled with the sounds of her strong band is what makes for some of the best music in country . it is her songs we should be hearing more often on the top 40 . but like so many other obscure talented song writers and singers , gift is left in obscurity on cut or gas and their award shows .

this woke me up . introductory song with just the guitar and the voice and the band kickin in after coupla bars . i stray paper . great . all songs written and song by the artist are good with one or two exceptions , mostly because of my personal taste . great backup band and lead and backup guitarists . bass and percussion , also . who is the piano player , no credit on the ad ? good album .
gift merritt has a great voice with a fresh style . one of the best cos i have purchased in a long time .

gift merritt tambourine is a remarkably strong set with no weak spots . her sound expands from the excellent bramble rose to include more of a soul punch . producer george drakoulias has worked with maria mckee ; and tambourine certainly has much of the appeal of the great lone justice lips . the opening track stray paper is addictive with mike campbells stinging lead guitar and merritt rocking vocal , somewhere there has a letter that i never sent . it used to read pretty , now it is empty as that night in the headlights with the blankets pressed . was it something to you baby , or was it just stray paper ? the second track wait it out also rocks with a vengeance , making this a great uptempo set . still pretending is a slow tune with a classic country or soul feel that encourages dusty in memphis comparisons . your love made a u - turn is another soul burner with a delightful horn section that urges me to hit the repeat button . maria mckee joins with background vocals on late night pilgrim . the ad ends on another high point with the driving toe tapper shadow in the way . tambourine shows gift merritt pulling together expressive vocalssome amounted songwriting and excellent musicianship for a blockbuster performance . wow !
ok readers guess you have to read the next book to see what has going on in this series.o moo mono o o

book 1 and book 2 down . now to read book 3 of this awesome series . i really like suspense and love all wrapped up in a book .

full of mystery , horror , romance and humor . a real page turner , had to read until finished . i can not wait for the next book .

i missed this little gem by artista main the first time round and was so pleasantly surprised at the delightful imagination and inventive twists and turns placed onto some of our favorite characters in recent history . well done , i have shared this over and over and will continue .
fabulous , old school elementssome amountaugh out loud often . will read again .
the christian right besieges san francisco post earthquake , and receive an unlikely welcome from an unlikely hero . i wanted more but this was fun reading .
funny , funny , funny but short . was just getting hooked when it ended . a must read for avid am fans !
it was a short read . was not what i expected , a bit far fetched but it will give you a laugh or two .
oh my god , i wish this story went on and on . someone , make this into a movie !
delightful story for fans of jackie o and what might have been .
a delightfully imaginative glimpse into her future that could - have - been .
pass , pass , pass , pass , du , best thing i have ever read . seemed more like a writing workshop project that would be assigned in a community college .
wish it were not so short but i get it . it was a magazine piece and it does finish in good main way .

one of the biggest challenges is to find source material that is recorded with the highest quality to test high end sound systems . this is one of those great finds that every high end audio system owner needs to test and demo their system with . each and every selection is recorded with the highest level one can find . it is truly rare to find such a high quality recorded source material . i would have given the rating a 5 , but found that some of the selections just did not seem to belong on this grouping of selections . if they would have been displaced with more appropriate selections it would have received the 5 rating for sure . both 5.1 to test your home theater and stereo material gives all the detail and nuances that will make the best systems shine and lesser systems fade .

this is what a blu - ray audio disc should sound like . perfect presentation and notes for the most discerning ear . the only downside is once you hear what music can sound like you will be upset that most sources will not come close .
if you are looking to hear the best of what your gear will do in terms of reproduction , this is a good ad to own .
this item is just noise . it does do a good job of testing your speakers and arange however . should be a some amount of money test piece nothing more .
this is definitely one of the better samplers . outstanding recording quality , and good selection of music too . was a little turned off by the price , but it was well worth it .

i would put this recording in my top - five all time sonic spectaculars . it is among the most realistic sounding productions i have ever heard . every instrument is finely articulated , both in timbre and space . it is like i can feel the air in the original recording room . borrow or beg this recording and see if you do not get the same experience .

i actually have not finished listening to the whole disk yeti about half way through . but this is pretty awesome . my surround system is a bose lifestyle v35 and pretty plain vanilla sassing blu - ray player . the clarity and feeling of being in a live presentation is probably the best i have heard from my system . the music is an eclectic mix of classical , new age , jazz and is really exciting . i can not believe i have not taken the time to listen to the rest of it . misplaced priorities on my part for sure . this is an expensive disk but if you have a high - performance surround system it is worth the money .

i am not a huge classical music fan , and most of the material on this disc would not typically appeal to me , but the stunning sound when played back on blu - ray through a high quality stereo would make anyone take notice . the included hybrid said is very useful for listening on a ad player or said player , but the sound from the blu - ray is really something else and leads to hope that i can get material that i really want to hear in the future .

as entreat to dorado muito mais do que as estimations da amazon . e os brazos estimates i so long's , daria desanimadores . into , quando o produco hear i minha mos , promote fazer del um review . finalmente chemo ! e dessa vez decorous i uma semana a mais do que a estimating . a qualidade , tanto do blu - ray quanto do said , incrvelmente fantastic . uma experince emocionante . referncia para tester e demosntrar um bom sister de audio .

it is another fine recordings from the norwegian 2l , suitable for testing purpose , because of fine music selection . only who listens the music closed to these discs can experience that not only advertisement the audiophile reference recordings on the cover art . what we get is really a five - star production !
if you have a good multi - channel sound setup and are an audiophile and enjoy great music this album is recorded in the highest fidelity possible and the sound is astounding !

i got cold chills down my spine several different times while listening to this compilation . the musical selections are varied and each is awesome in it is own way but some are absolutely transcendent . being able to directly compare the sound of 5.1 against . 2 channel , said against . blu - ray , and lucm against . its he ma is very nice , they could have easily just put all of the tracks in blu - ray lucm and been done with it but being able to switch back and forth a or i style and finally hear an apples to apples comparison for yourself is very useful . if you are considering this disc i wholeheartedly encourage you to get it , otherwise you are missing out on wonderful music and a chance to make your system truly sing .

i was looking for new things to try with cauliflower and kale and this book is exactly what i was looking for , there are some great recipes and a variety to choose from .
couple good recipes but overall unimpressed . i was anticipating more natural , family friendly meals to introduce . recipes were very similar of each other and other existing recipes .
my husband follows an atkins diet and i do a plant based so there has something for both of us . very nice .
these recipes look simple and tasty , i am really looking forward to testing a few of them in my kitchen .

i have been trying to incorporate more veggies into my diet and with gardening season in full swing i am going to have more kale and cauliflower than i know what to do with . this book has some delicious recipes that i can not wait to try !
i love the tuscan kale soup and the mexicauli rice and i am looking forward to trying the other recipes in this book .

i have not tried the recipes yet but i have read them all and they are simple to prepare and look delicious ! there are nice photos for each recipe which is great . i am especially interested in using the ones chopping up the cauliflower for use like rice with other ingredients . i know i will be using recipes from this book .
practical and clear recipes for everyday use for small and large families . easy to read . good layout for grocery shopping .

i am gluten and dairy free not exactly by choice and this collection of thoughtful recipes is a huge blessing to me . cauliflower is a great choice for losing weight as well as well as having other health benefits which the author , sally , points out . kale is great for weight loss and full of vitamins and minerals . i happen to grow lots of kale in my garden and this book provides some new ideas for me to try . these recipes are delicious and will add lots of new variety to your treasury of meals . gluten and or or dairy free or not , these recipes are going to become a mainstay from my kitchen .

these recipes put two amazing but overlooked vegetables to work in your kitchen . and they are amazing ! from the tuscan kale soup to the kale taco soup these recipes will blow you away , they are restaurant quality . also includes nutrition info and great pictures , bravo !

i love this recipe book which has clearly been devised and written by someone who loves creating and cooking imaginative meals and snacks . the illustrations are great and add so much to the authenticity of the book . so many recipe books are just a rehash of recipes available elsewhere but this book is innovative . highly recommended for anyone who loves these two superfood
excellent cookbook ! really excellent . i have found several new things that have been delicious and i have really liked the spice combinations .
i especially like the cauliflower recipes , as we are big fans of cruciferous veggies . simple - i really like that . all i older recipes have too many fats and calories

i really like that she gives options in the recipes for vegetarian and or paleo diets . i do not follow either way of eating , but it is nice to have meatless options sometimes . there are several recipes that i can not wait to try .
i really like the recipes and this book helps me think of current favorite recipes that i can make using cauliflower or kale to make them more low carb friendly !
great commentary , analysis and polemics on culture , politics , business and life .
what can you say except how much this magazine inspires , educates , entertains and provokes one on a weekly basis ! i only wish we could get access to their wine club on this side of the pond .
great british magazine . i have been reading it for years .

a great deal from amazon . the print and full digital subscriptions are prohibitively expensive . the kindle version gives you 85 - a percentage and all the great book reviews and columns . not to be missed . my favorite magazine .
really enjoyed seeing the specie againhowever , missed the cartoons and the feel of the magazinepity it is so expensive here in cape town to subscribe !
an excellent magazine after reviewing the first 2 issues .

the spectator provides me with up to date information and opinion on current affairs , the state of the uk and alternative views on life in general that is not available from any other magazine . the independent comes close .
i always enjoy reading the spectator when i am on vacation . lots of good articles and it is fun to see things from a different point of view than i get from local news and magazines
the thing is , i agree with most of what is written in the specie
similar to the new statesman but just on the other side of the political fence . very enjoyable read

it has been all of my life the best magazine for opening up your mind . courageous editing and brilliant writing make it tops in the world . it is conservative but unlike american conservative journals it does not hesitate to run alternative ideas . the writing , the columns and the reviews make it the best read you can find in a week , or , the best i have found in 50 years . llewelyn king ,

one of the finest periodicals for two hundred years . excellent politically incorrect writing . incisive . funny . at times , painful . in american culture dominated by the left , everything is tolerated except a difference of opinion . in the us , if the mob does not like your private ideas or ideals you must lose your job , your business , and possibly your life . in britain , free speech survives , and people actually write and publish what they actually think . you noisome amounting we used to two hundred years ago .

good material , except too little international affairs . the layout is in kindle e - read version , rather than magazine layout , which makes it look a bit home made . making the layout magazine version would lift the overall quality tremendously . good magazine , but not for those looking for extensive analysis of international affairs . for that i can only recommend magazines such as the economist or the global intelligence .
wide ranging magazine offering incisive articles on politics and other subjects , highly recommended for people who like to keep up to date with current views

the spectator is a delightful publication the articles about books , the arts , politics and daily life in great britain are very well written . i feel as if i get a good overview of british life and it reads well on the kindle . the tone is light and satirical and no one suggests that if one does not agree with a particular point of view civilization as we know it is over i am enjoying my reasonably priced subscription very much
wished there was more of it . really good easy to read sci - fi . looks like a crossing between galactica and buck rogers .
sci fi book . something like dune and star wars .specially tatooine . this book can be a movie . great worrisome amountittle bit complicated story but page turning book
was much shorter then expected but enjoyed what looks to be a prologue to the series . enjoyed this very much .
a good back story to the first toward book . it gave more insight into the culture and enemies of the rural . can not wait for the next book .
a great read with interesting characters and a tantalising introduction to this universe . quite short , but as it is free that is not a problem . highly recommended .
neither are well thought out . both could be turned into something and i am sure that was the intention but it left too much to be desired .

i did not like this couple in the first book so it is no real surprised i did not enjoy spending time with them here . they were simply unlikable and i never connected with them . i am looking forward to book 3 although !

nice diversion and introduction to the toward series . these shorts are intertwined with each other . actually 2 of the stories are the same , told from two different points of view . the basics of the toward is as follows . an alien race who are bidding the fact that they are technologically advanced , and what happens when the human race gets involved with them .
i just started reading this book and enjoying it will have it done in a little time . it is a good read .
i love the content it should be a very interesting concept . i am looking forward to the next - generation as i write this so i can get the next - generation now .

a prequel is useful for getting answers to those how did that come about ? questions we often have after reading a story . these stories reveal how the human ambassador and his wife met a toward province ruler and the ruler of the entire planet . the toward appear to be country bumpkins stuck in a life style similar to earths feudal period in europe . all is not as it seems . the ambassadors wife wields more power than her husband , the province ruler is making a power play using the humans as pawns , and the real leader of the toward is working hard to keep his people out of the spotlight . good writing and well worth the read for back - ground material . editing was fine and most of the characters appear again in maranun .

i thoroughly enjoyed this short introduction to a new author to me and a new culture . the two short stories are really the same story , told from the points of view of the human and the toward perspective . even although it is the same story , different insights into the planets culture are gained from each . i found myself wanting to know lonesome amounts more ! the human appearing toward have been there where the humans are now . exploring space and meeting other races , but chose to abandon all that and now keep to their planet developing their inner abilities . they are also hiding all that , and more , from their human visitors . the character development was adequate for a short story but i want to learn more about the rural and the johann . can not wait to read the longer novels .
this is a wonderful series . i highly recommend these short stories , as well as the maranun and daughters of solar . keep em coming !

the humans visit solar for the first time . it is almost as if they are the aliens . the environment on solar appears to be just as the humans expected . their encounter suddenly takes an unexpected turn for everyone involved near the end . life in toward space seems to be going on like normalfor everyone except a couple of rulers and some quiet labor workers . as the moral thinks he is scheming behind everyone is back . little does he know , the rural lurks . what are each partys motives for wanting to encounter the other ? maybe different than meets the eye . the author does a fabulous job of showing how the two worlds come together in a brief but articulate manner . whether or not you have read a previous work , a recommend for all ! even more excited for the next book to come out after reading this !
enjoyed the stories . looking forward to more from this series . the writer tells wonderful in depth stories . i would read the first book . also .
