i give this release 3.5 stars it is their debut album and debut releases are not always the best releases but you have to start some where . i listen to it but not as often as some of their late releases . i consider it a springboard for what was down the road .

love to , old school rock and roll from the good ole days , when rock really existed . this band was quite underrated in their day , often criticized for their diet , shape , form , or use of chords when in fact all they delivered was hard hitting guitar riffs , catchy chords and choruses and great vitals . this up is one of their less mainstream titles , but one of my favorites . randy bachman , pictured on the cover , was once one of the main forces behind the guess who and is inducted into the canadian rock and roll hall of fame , both as a solo artist as well as with to . superb recordsome amounting it a listen .

this is bros first album , originally released back in 1972 . the cuts are outstandingblue collar and hold back the water alone are worth the price of admission here . buy this to understand why to became what they were , and why , simply , they are the best damn band in the world .

i purchased this album to give the new lead singer a listen . i am a hard core steve perry fan and although ariel pined resembles steve , he does not capture the soul that steve put into every single song . steve perry is truly the heart and soul of journey . try as they might . he will never be replaced .

why addictive ? . i have been listening only to this album and it is songs since i have gotten it and nothing else . i love the ballads and the rock out tunes on both ad while thumping my feet to the beats . and never got bored with it . the new songs are great while the re - recorded classic hits are just as good . the did footage is excellent and i probably viewed it more than ten times already in it is entirety . also i have anticipated the release of this album with much excitement especially when they acquired ariel pined . this guy is very talented and has a unique voice that delivers journeys songs in their legacy sound trademark . i know my place in appreciating good music and good musicianship of talented artist like journey and will not waste my thoughts on comparing the perry or pined debacle . i would say get over it folks if you are . bottoming is , i love journey during the perry days and i love them now just the same with much anticipation of great music to come down the road for their fans . this is a great albumsome amount get one .

i will tell you right up front adore steve perry and wish he would never left the band . he will never be replaced in our hearts . however , at some point we all have to let go of the past and move forward . i just got my copy of revelation and i love it . ariel pined can do justice to journeys old sound , but he has creating a new journey sound all his own . i have always felt that the other replacement singers were trying too hard to emulate steve perry . that is probably why we never could accept them . i suspect they were chosen just for their voices , not because they had any magic spark that made the whole group click . i think ariel has the magician like journey has risen from the dead . now i wish that steve perry would put out another albumthe world would be a better place if he would share his voice with us again .

my favorite part of the disc has ariel pines vocals on classic journey hits , which i think does a fantastic job of assuring everyone that pined has the skill and vocal charm to measure up to anyone who came before him . in fact , he has a stronger vocalist than perry and articulates better pines lyrics are clearer , easier to understand . i think it is cool to have one of the all - time great bands open to the idea of hiring a singer who are not from around here . revelation is a great album , and i am very happy i finally picked it up .

another very predictable white bread album from a band that lost it is soul when steve the band killer perry ruined a very great rock group . put the ad in , sit back a beat your head with a hammer for even thinkin about buying this album . the new singer will be gone after this hokum tour which will never touch the guitar strap of the greg rollie band . hey journey fans get off the pot .
i received my journey ad and i loved it alot , i listen to it alot crank up the volume in my car and rock out , but i am lookin more forward to seeing them in concert .

for all the crap that is out there right now , this ad is a breath of fresh air and a great mix of power ballads , soft ballads , and rock . neil schon is probably one of the most underrated guitarist of all time . he really meshes his guitar licks with the lead singers voice exceptionally well . that said , there is no doubt that true journey fans miss steve perry . i mean , my god , he is the greatest voice in rock history there can not be an arguement here . this new singer ariel is somewhat comparable to perry because of the soul he provides in the songs and the better than average stage presence with the other band members . remember , steve perry is a legend and no one will replace him . so , all the 1,2,3 star reviewers do not understand that this band is on a journey and kinda symbolic in a way that someday they all may be in wheelchairs playing with steve perry returning as lead singer . ah for wishful thinking .
this album includes two discs and a live did ! an incredible deal ! this is going to put journey back on the map !

the new singer is more of a performer then my rock star steve perry . this guy not only bring back the classic sound but room to grow ! if perry were in the band there would be no new albums and they would be on the oldies tour ! this is the best they have sounded in years ! ariel is not a rock star but singer who wants it bad not live in the past ie : steve perry , axel rose ! just listen to the ad it is better than a percentage of the new stuff ! it is 2008 not 1981 ! welcome back journey with open arms !

thank you neal schon for picking ariel pined to be the lead singer of journey . steve perry was like jose carrera , a tenor with more refine voice . however , ariel pined is like pavoratti , a power tenor . definitely journey made the right decision to go forward with ariel , who will bring back old fans and create new fans . and thank you to youtube.com for providing endless hours of great clips of old journey music , zoo cover music , and new journey concerts in chile and las vegas . this is a great album that will move journey to the forefront of melodic rock music scene again !
listened to both cos and disappointing . many cuts are remastered , and not done well in my opinion . i will not recommend revelation , and in fact will put it in my very next garage sale !

all that i can say about journey revelation , is that steve perry should be honored . the vocals done by ariel pined on this ad are outstanding . obviously , ariel has studied steve perry . not only vocally but physically as well . he sounds and looks like him . i bought this ad not knowing what to expect as i have bought other journey cos in the past during steves absences . this one however has amazed me . it took me back in time and if you close your eyes and listen , steve all of the sudden appears . excellent job ariel ! . this man was journeys best choice in a replacement vocalist . this ad is simply awesome . i hope that ariel decides to make his home a terminate one with journey in the cos to come . jonathan cain is still the best around , the band sounds great . with revelation , they have themselves a true gem .
really fast service ! i really appreciated that . i love the charnel pined is awesome !
i did not realize how much i missed the music of the 80s until this ad was released . i can not say enough how much i love this group and can not wait for a tour to come .
it is fantastic . even the did plays well !
this sounds like a best of misfits ringtones album . jerry only did not brainchild this one did he ? wow .

butler brass was around before bef by a couple years . but that is not the point i it does not matter how original or unoriginal something is . either you like it or you do not . i ve been a misfits fan since the olde days and i have to say i was skeptical about this . but it is really entertaining and well done . like another reviewer said , if you have no sense of humor , this is not for you !

geez ? ! i haven't heard the album , but listening to the samples here on amazon i got to say no thanx ! i shall take the originals any day , also , are those real instrument ? it all sound electronicsome amounting a midi , or something . blech ! me no like this .

i gave this 4 stars because it is what it is , it is a novelty ad and that is it . but what could have been done with is more of a swing , big band style with vocals and a little guitar wow that would have been great . but all in all it is a great ad for hold music i know that is what i am using it for or even elevator music . so all in all it is still not that bad of a ad could have been ten more on it but hey that is just me . would have loved to hear some of the michael graves era songs on it .

i am a bigtime amounting - time misfits fan , old stuff and new , and i thought this was a great project . it is not like richard cheese , where some dorky lounge guy sings the songs all funkyinstead , it is just instrumental versions of some old misfits classics , done in some different big - band musical styles . the styles actually change a lot , often in the same song , and there has more depth to this than you might expect at first . punk purists might hate it , but i think it is cheery driving music .

i really did like the 50s new misfits album , and thought that this ad could be okay . it had potential , however , this is not the lounge music i expected ; instead , it is techno - lounge that , worse yet , hardly resembles any of the misfits songs no matter how hard you listen to it , sober or not . this album is a giant disappointment .
dear jerry only just when i thought it could not get any worse than you selling misfits cowboy hats , it did . please go away . thanks .

before buying this disc i heard a mp3 of skulls , without knowing that it was performed by butler brass . the next song i heard from it was die die my darling , then i got shocked about the outstanding performances by butler brass . the sounds , the rhythm and the arrangements are amazing . it is difficult to forget the original version , but this one plays a relaxing role when listening . being a misfits fan , i really recommend this disc to everyone interested not just in their music but the influences on a totally different genre .

this album proves one thing and one thing only : jerry only is desperate for money . instead of whoring himself out on the street , or even selling crack cocaine , jerry only has whored out his band . not only is the album painful to listen to , but it further destroys this bands legacy . it would appear that mr. only in the last decade or so has made a concerted effort to destroy the legacy of his band . this album makes a good frisbee , and little else .

if you like richard cheese , quirky covers , squirrel nut zippers , misfits , louie prima , save your money . i like the devo and ramones ez listening covers but this is lame casino synth organ horns , not lounge music . think mystery science theater closing theme . sorry joel ! big fan . if you realy want this album and you live in los angeles , i plan to wing my copy onto interstate 5 . wish i would read the reviews like you are . try some me first and the give me , gimme or dread zeppelin .

hey , after reading some of the reviews on this product , i was hesitant on getting this . however , i just received this as a christmas present and i am pleasantly surprised . this ad is fun . they picked the best of the best misfits tunes to re - do . i only wish american nightmare was on here , but the rest are great . for those who say that they can not even make out which song is being re - done , i doubt that they are true fans . true fans would know . true fans can easily pick out the songs . do not listen to the idiots who gave this 1 star . when it comes to instrumental music , i am sure they are more comfortable listening to kenny g.

cmon , ever hear of beating a dead horse ? well jerry only and the like have been beating the same one for nearly ten damn years . we love this misfits with glenn , we know the songs , we have bought oodles of merchandise now just let it die before you destroy everything glenn danzig built . i mean how many big screen t.against playing the scream video over and over does jerry only need ?

i am a vocalist and to warm up singing i would practice singing misfits songs in a lounge style . so already i was excited to hear about the ad . this is wonderful and everything i expected . it also gives me something to practice to .

jerry onlyfor the love of all that is unholy , enough is enough . this is without a doubt the most ridiculous cover album ever conceived . give the moron your by buying the box set , downloading in the doorway from static age , and be done with it .

seriously , this is a lame and blatant attempt to sucker fans out of their money . i have never been so disappointed in something that carried the misfits logo on it . i am a fan of the danzig era , i am a fan of the michael graves era . i even like the current lineup with jerry , dez , and robo . i will always support the misfits no matter what , but this album is just trash . this album for one was not performed with the true spirit of the misfits in mind . this my friends was made for one purpose , an easy , cheeky way to make a buck . after three songs you will find yourself shutting it off . i actually made it to song 5 before i decided i could not take anymore . their is no vocals on this album , just cheeky casinos and piped in strings . i would put this album on the same level as the worst songs on the pac man fever album .
enjoyed this book very much . definitely lots of unfinished story . can not wait to read more . for some odd reason i kept envisioning taylor swift while reading this . odd i know

i just can not say enough about how much i loved this book ! i am so enchanted by reaper and harmony . they are just the cutest , mismatched and exciting couple . i love the rocker meets country that is happening . i am excited about this new series and looking forward to reading more of them . love it !

for regular readers of laramie frisco , you know she can weave danger , mystery , and steamy scenes together like a champ in the heaven hill series . what i love about only the beginning is that is completely different from those books . i actually read this one right after reading the latest he book , and it was a great way of coming down from such an emotional ride in that book . this book is about two celebrities who meet by chance and just spark right away . i have always been fascinated by how celebrities deal with all the gossip and untruths from the press and this book is a great peek into that world . i liked that even although they were both completely different musically , that just did not even come into play . it was their own emotional issues they had to deal with . there are some very emotional depths in this book . there is one scene where i literally cried real tears . i do not do that often but i did it here . for those who love the heaven hill books , this is completely different from that , but if you are in the mood for something a bit lighter and not as dark , it is a great read !
loved this book . very sweet . wanted the story to keep going on for ever . could not put the book down . from the first page i was hooked .

i loved that the characters were so well developed . i loved the story line and i love that she was able to conquer her past without someone doing it for her . i enjoyed the book and can not wait to read the next one .

oh my god this book was amazing ! i felt like i could not get enough ! a percentage into the book i was totally completely in love with garrett ! i need lonesome amounted i can not wait for more ! laramie you keep on amazing me !
i love this book . i would so recommend this book
i really liked this book and can not wait to see what happens next with hannah and garrett
i really liked this book . the story of a rock star and a country star flowed very good . i am really looking forward to the next one .

i loved this book ! i am a country girl who also loves rock ! this book brought both worlds together and the story was awesome . i could not put it down once i started . reaper was the perfect man to help harmony through her own emotional demons brought on by her evil ex . it is never okay to abuse anyone and this book brought that to the forefront . they have great secondary characters that are really involved . it addresses so many issues that many people deal with . this is a great read .
totally loved this bookie was well written with a nice story line and can not wait to finish the second book which i am eading it now . thanks for awesome job
this is one of laramie first books and i have read it a hundred times . the chemistry is fabulous and you will totally fall in love with reaper !
a must read i love how they feel in love even when they where in to diffrent glmisic groups can not wait for 2
i loved it and could not put it down . the relationship building between garrett and hannah was beautiful . i can not wait to read more about their journey .

this book was fabulous ! the characters were great and relatable . you felt their struggles along with them . the whole concept was different from.any thing i have ever read and it worked out perfectly !
loved it ! short story but amazing world building . would loved to read more set in this world
please write us a full length novel about arena and duncan . i love this short story so much ! their novel will be a gorgeous story !

quickly but clearly drawn world and characters in a fast paced story with neatly done closure . the problem with a short story like this is you are left wanting to see further adventures . not too adult for tween or teen or ya but not too juvenile for adults .

this was a short but very cute story by ilona andrews , once again featuring a strong female lead . i liked the blend of realistic embarrassment and awkwardness with the raw power . even the unlikeable characters were well - written and amusing .
short and moderately funny . enjoyable like candy , but not really satisfying . similar to the other short stories that were not published in mythologies .
i really liked this short story . great characters and funny plot . i would love to see more of this world , soon .

when arena is talked into going on a date with the local head thug , she knows it is not going to go well . the problem is that if she refuses , her family will lose face in the magical society . but she has know chad since childhood and knows the day will not go well . it is worse than she imagines . this does not seem to be a part of any series which is a little unusual for ilona andrews . but it still sounds like a fascinating world with some great characters . it seems a little lighter in tone than their kate daniels series . it is nice to have a lighter tale every once in a while . i would not mind seeing more stories from this world .
i must own every ilona andrews book so they wool keep writing . such imagination . great character development , i want to know what is going to happen to them even after the story has finished

i have not read a bad book or novella or short story by ilona andrews . so far i have loved everything they have written but this one was just sweet and fun . i did not like the bully thug , chad , that our heroine was having to date . and the date was totally unique . i particularly liked the pig and arenas reaction to said pig . i had to stifle my laughter to not disturb others in the library . this was a fun read and i am probably going to reread it later .
this is absolutely brilliant . i am hopelessly addicted to ilona andrews , and i am surprisingly unperturbed that the plot lines are a little formulaic .

i just had a day worthy of comparison to that date , minus the ending . well written and an exceedingly perfect ending . 4 stars for the writing and 1 for being exactly what i needed as a pick me up .

the bad part of any of ilona andrews books ? when they end ! this book fits with the authors typical writingfull characters that burst off the page , story lines that snag you from the start , and laugh - out - loud moments that leave my husband looking as although he has unsure if he should track down an appropriate loony bin for me . keep up the great work ilona andrews !
very cute story set in an interesting world . definitely someplace i want to know more about and read other books that are set in .
loved it . great novella . ideal for tweens and anyone who looks a sweet story .

of swine and roses is a hysterically funny look at how wrong a date can go in a world where magic is normal . this short story has a place on my books to read when i feel bad shelf . ilona andrews writes stories that always entertain .
this is by far the best ad i have purchased in a long time . ruthie foster is the etta james of this era . i highly recommend this ad . i also had great and fast service from this seller .

i have seen ruthie live and have viewed all live performances on youtube , and more her live performances are much , much better than her studio recordings . i have all of her cos and her studio performances or recordings seem to restrict her voice , singing , and personality too , too much . she is truly a phenomenal singer the best pure , natural , and real singer out there these days and outstanding electric and acoustic guitar player as well as an excellent pianist . and , boy , what a personality ! please , go see her live everybody and hear the real thing ! or at least check out her live performances onlineespecially those at the new york city living room .
there has nothing pretentious about this ad . i would like to be in the room with these musicians while they are doing the music to experience it first hand .

i stopped listening to any kind of radio a few years ago , so my exposure to new artists to me is via the internet . i was on youtube watching clips of sister rosetta thorpe up above my head and saw a clip of ruthie foster doing a cover , needless to say i was intrigued and sought out her music and bought this release . what a treat . her blues or soul sensibilities are refreshing . i will be be exploring the rest of her catalog , which i am sure i will enjoy .
an artist who spans the skills of old blues singers and contemporary blues singer or songwriters . her voice quality is classy classic .
the title says it all . sounds like a mix of aretha franklin and gladys knight with a little texas flair !

ruthie foster is the best kept secret in america . i learned about her music from a friend who lives in canada . one listen was all it took to realize that this was a performer i needed to follow . i started with runaway soul which still moves me after almost daily listening . her songs inform life . this newest ad release phenomenal ruthie foster has a bit of a self - congratulatory and cheesy title , but the songs are not to be missed . celebrate her beautiful voice on the song i do not know what to do with my heart , or moan with the blues of mama said . foster is firmly in touch with every genre of north american music . she turns competently between traditional spirituals and more contemporary pop or folk tunes . i could go on and on , but will stop just to say that you owe it to your soul to listen to this ad . and all of ruthie recordings .

i heard ruthie foster in an interview on nor national public radio , on studio 360 . nor has done this to me before ; hooked me on a sound i would never experienced previous . i have this ad in my cubicle at work and it is all i can do not to dance or sing out loud . i am going to have to get a copy for the car and one for the house i think . this was my first foster experience and it is as profound as bob marley singing no woman , no cry . and maya angelo's poem phenomenal woman set to song by foster is . i do not have the words .

i bought this because i found it used for some amount of money in a shop and had seen the name out there but had no expectations for the music before listening . i played this in the car on the way home and was into the songs from the very start of the disc . this woman can really sing and covers a lot of ground from the church to the delta blues , all very well done . there is no overbearing instruments on this and her voice really shines through . i also liked the electric piano that is used on several of the cuts which was a very sympathetic backing to her vocals . not sure if she played the majority of the piano or not because ruthie and anthony farrell are both listed as having played the piano . it does not betterthis is a very good ad and i will be exploring more of ruthie foster in the future !

do yourself a favorwhether it be this album or any other ruthie fostersome amounted it or several . her voice is raw , powerful , pure , magical . what and when she sings is from the heart and soyou can hear it in her voice or watch her on stage as her joy and love of music shines through on every note , sung or not . ruthie foster is a gem and you will not be disappointed . her rendition of a sun house tune is enough to make any blues fan or any music fan a fan of hers .

i pre - ordered the ad and received it today . it is moving , powerful , and just warms my soul . the last song , i do not know what to do with my heart brought me to tears . ruthie is an amazingly talented and beautiful artist . if you have never heard ruthie foster sing beforeyou will be a fan for life after hearing this ad .
i bought this one for my wife . then i stole it from her . she wants it back . now .
had to replace a copy that i bought when ruthie came to my town . played it so much , my copy was scratched up so i had to get a new one .

about once a month i go to my local used record store to see what they are selling for under some amount of money yesterday i was lucky enough to find this ad . thus far , it is one of the stand - outs of what i brought home with me . i am already looking forward to searching out and finding her new album as well . ruthie has a great voice and is a wonderful talent but in my ears , what makes this album so good is the fact that she does not over sing the music . there has not a lot of showing off or vocalizing for the sake of vocalizing . she sings wonderfully throughout and is able to groove and swing with the best of them . this is a great soul album . mostly laid back tunes . i look forward to hearing more recordings by ruthie i am thinking i will track down the truth and probably pay full price!keep up the good worrisome amounting . you earned me as a fan yesterday and i am starting to spread the word today !
saw ruthie live in a show with several other great performers and went looking for a ad . i do not know if i just picked the wrong one but i have never been able to sit through the whole thing .

i thoroughly enjoyed this soundtrack . it has the classic sound of indiana jones and is a lot of fun to listen to . john williams is brilliant in reviving one of our favorite heroes . i am so glad i decided to buy it . a beautiful soundtrack to add to your collection .

of course , film fans have high expectations when going to see and hear indiana jones films . i am not different . sadly , john williams has not created anything truly memorable in this score . it only comes to life when one hears the familiar retreads from the original . other tracks sound like jurassic park , harry potter , or superman leftovers . only does the track the adventures of mutt possess some of the spark that was the key behind the success to the first jones film . i realize that composers can revisit themselves or borrow from others , but williams usually throws in something new in each of his film compositions . i just do not hear it in crystal skull .

as expected , john williams does his usual great job on this score . i do not think this will get him an oscar , but this will hold it is own with the best of his scores . no john williams fan should pass this one up .

john williams is by far the most accomplished and successful composers in hollywood . i will stand by that till my dying day . unfortunately , ijatkotcs is not one of his greatest works . a beautiful nostalgic opening with the raiders march is about as good as it is gon na get with this one . unlike the star wars series where each character has his or her very distinctive theme music that would literally stay in your head the rest of your life , this piece of work although technically sound really has nothing signature about it . it quite frankly left me bored by the end . very different from the music of it is predecessors , which did not really surprise me at all considering the film itself does not come close to the original trilogy either . the main reason i bought this album was because the previous 3 are impossible to find today and i really was not too keen on missing a 4th time round . nothing distinctive here !

without going into too much detail this soundtrack is nothing short of great . i have only listened to it once and it is already begining to stick in my mind . what more could you ask for , this is indiana jones . even some of the newer score is fantastic . as soon as the raiders march started i began to feel like a young child once again , carefree and innocent and that is a great feeling . simply put , if the music makes you feel good inside then it must be doing everything right . thanks again john williams .
i do not care what the evil film critics say , i loved this film . the soundtrack is just as good . now i have all four of the indiana jones soundtracks . john williams is the greatest .

i listened intently when i saw the movie the other day for anything original that stood out like in the other 3 movies that is the marion love theme from raiders ; the slave mining theme and indian village themes and willie scott love theme from temple of doom ; the grail theme , father or son theme , and more but there was nothing that i heard specifically that stayed with me . i did hear a lot of familar music cues from the other movies marion theme and the grail theme surprising used extensively towards the end of the movie . just like the movie , i felt the score was rushed and williams basically phoned this in . of all his scores , this one was really lacking .

the soundtrack to indiana jones and the crystal skull is again written in the old hollywood action adventure sound , and we again thank you for it . indiana jones music hurries you thru from one threat to the next but takes the time to let it all sink in with the music taking you from one crescendo to the next . without it , indie would just be another some amountetter word . see the movie , but make sure you buy the soundtrack !

with arguably one of moviedoms finest anthems in the raiders march to build off of , john williams once again shows why he is probably the finest movie theme composers of all time . for all time indy fans , it is wonderful to hear little snippets of previous indy films worked into this score , as well as new and exciting original pieces to further the legend of indiana jones .

i was hoping to get another great indy score , but unfortunately we just get another indy score . whimsical . that is all i can say about it . most of the cues , including some of the larger action pieces just sound like indy and the gang are out having a rollicking good time keeping up with the commies . there has only a few cues where you actually feel like there has any kind of threat . williams is by far my favorite composer of all time and having listened to all of his scores countless times , he tends to borrow from himself once in awhile . in this score , i hear a little far and away , a little hook and something that i did not expect . 3min 22sec into track 13 we hear a note for note cue from war of the worlds ! ? ! ? track 4 the intersection scene 38 sec into cue . not sure what that means yet , i guess we will all know may 22nd . i after seeing the film , it means nothing . much like the movie itself . a whole lot of nothing

john williams rarely strikes out , and he has definitely not in this latest composition from indiana jones and the kingdom of the crystal skull . the indiana jones theme is what everyone remembers . i would rank it as one of the best motion picture themes . the rest of the soundtrack is very good . there is nostalgia woven throughout this soundtrack . marion theme is back and is found in several of the tracks , whether it be a a few seconds or not . some of the last crusade music makes a return as well , at very appropriate times in the movie . i think it is an indication of how well the composition is by how well you are moved by the music and this made me recall all of the fond memories of indiana jones moments . there are some rather different themes at play but very much in tune with the theme of the film . until the other 3 soundtracks get re - released , this is your best chance to have the indy theme .

got this soundtrack for my sister for her birthday , we both love it . i ripped it to my xbox 360 elite had and we listen to it while we play halo 3 together . thanks for a great product . go john williams !
this soundtrack is awesome the best soundtrack to the best movie buy this soundtrack if your a fan of the classic movie or a soundtrack fan you will not be sorry
this is an exceptionally well done score . several of the themes literally give me chills and the orchestrations are vintage williams . this is the best score i have bought all year .

there has really two ways at looking at this . the all too familiar raiders march and map room cues are used to anchor this ad , but unfortunately there are no new cues to differentiate crystal skull from the original three movies . from one viewpoint it serves as a reminder of all the things that were good about the originals both as fun iconic films and the memorable music that accompanied each . but as an original work , this ad fails almost across the board for me . i did not want a nostalgia piece , i own the previous three scores with the new film , i wanted something updated and fresh but still part of the indiana jones universe and it does not succeed in that respect . while the trademark williams ability is here , it just seems like potential unfulfilled . a new indy jones movie soundtrack should have been a benchmark work , not solely a reminder of what once was great .
why all the negative comments ? this was certainly a pleasant read . i have read all in the series . found the one on piper the most entertaining . reading them in order is best but not necessary .

this book was a cute romance with two characters that fell for each other right at the start . the book also introduces the other members of the peregrine family and their close friends . once you have read this book you will want to know about the other members . even although there were a few errors with regards to some of the names it does not deter from the lovely story .

i have not read a romance novel in a while . this novel was a nice deviation from lifes seriousness . i enjoyed the character poppy . she was simply refreshing and full of life . declan had a charm that i found intriguing and i could actually feel why he was such a strong temptation for poppy . the story kept pulling me back to see what was going to happen next between the two . the book did need some editing in some spots , but i enjoyed the story and was able to overlook those . i am impressed with this first time author , and would encourage her to continue developing her writing . i am looking forward to her next story !

this is a sweet historical romance and the title is very misleading . declan was devastated to lose his older brother gabriel and has dedicated himself to the estate in seclusion since unexpectedly becoming the duke of hawley . after 3 years he decides to accept an invitation to spend the summer with his best friend the marquis of ashford . when he arrives he finds the marquis sister poppy in her wild garden by chance and is immediately entranced by her . poppy is a lively and bright and is also struck by declan . she has three seasons behind her and has rejected all proposals . for the first time she is fascinated by a man . there are no major intrigues . it is a gentle love story that unfolds at a summer party . the focus is on the intense attraction and growing love between declan and poppy . the writing and events are lively and keep the pages turning , perhaps in a jane austen style but with more spice . the other characters are interesting , even to the point of hoping for their stories in future . in fact , i see that poppy twin sister piper is the subject of ` seduce me please and i have just ordered my copy .

did an editor ever read this ? was it proofread ? the writing is clich and sounds like an adolescent girl writing in her journal . i have to agree with incognito character development , no consideration given to any consistency of point of view it switched four times in four paragraphs , no motivation , and horrendous sentence structure . i can not comment on the progress of the plot because after reading the first a percentage of the text i just quit . what a waste of some amount of money in my old life h.s. writing and writing for publications teacher this author would have been roasted by her peers during her first reading to the writers circle . their feedback would have been start over because there would have been nothing to work on improving .
thin plot , characters with no personality , and i do not think anyone bothered to proofread the manuscript ; spelling and grammar errors abound throughout the book and are very distracting .

i hate not finishing a book . but i just could not . this one , with some proper guidance and editing might have held promise , but . i could not stick around to finish it . please , before this author writes another book , please take time to edit it , spell check , and have someone look over the grammar , and more this felt like a first draft . just could not do it . it hurt too much .

it has been so long since i have read a good romance novel , and i was so enthralled with ruin me please i was unable to put it down . the love story between poppy and declan has just a pure spirit and true love that the entire time you are wanting to take in more and more of their powerful love . by the end of the book i was wishing i lived in that time and made me miss chivalry and genuine love , i want my own castle ruin . i can not wait for more , because not only are you drawn into the main characters romance but the supporting characters have love stories intertwined in the book as well . nicole matthews really knows how to reach the romance part of a womans heart , it was sensual , sensitive , caring , respectful , intoxicating all at once . in a time where romance is dead and divorce and heartache are the norm it is refreshing to be swept away from it all , and that is exactly what ruin me please did for me !

it had potential . and i forced myself through the book , hoping it would get better . i actually found misspellings in this and the grammar structure was horrible . get this girl an editor that can help re - write portions of the book and maybe she will have something ! a book with potential is still a crappy book . my advice to the author if she reads these : keep trying and find a good editor and some readers that will give you honest and sound advice .

why is not there an option for zero stars ? the previous reviewers covered it i just want to add my amen . the writing is simply awful , the characters are a mess , and more , etc . it is the old rakes - and - virgins scenario taken to the extreme . like olde mrs. i , i got through a percentage and quit ; this author needs to find another career .
this author has made her characters so real you feel like you are part of the group . i fell asleep reading this . i could not put it down .

i read this book last and now want to read 2 3 again to pick up on the details that i missed that were hinted to in book 1 , while this book does not have the damsel in distress that the others do , it was thoroughly enjoyable to read . besides who would ever think of poppy as a damsel in distress . i do hope a 4th is on it is way about peyton !

the cover makes you think it may be an erotic novel . it is not . but i knew it was not . seems an odd cover for a historical romance . unfortunately , this book suffered from at the very least , someone to proofread it , make sure the grammar was up to snuff . it could stand a good editor too . the writing felt a little too much on the juvenile side and too dramatic . the hero and the heroine acted that way too . i am glad they allow sampling because i strongly recommend readers sample the book before purchasing .

i have never given a book a one star review . that was generous for this rival . how this ever received positive reviews is boggling . it was painful to read three chapters and not wonder at the age of the author and thinking maybe this was a grade school project . i could not even finish . my 13 year old writes better stories and with less repeating of the same line and phrase again and again . the reviews that rate this book good have to be friends of the author and trying to boost her up , or else this was meant for grade school .
i really enjoyed this book it was fun and lively . it was a quick read that i was not able to put down .

daft punks discovery gets put through the ringer by some house and hip - hop luminaries . the resulting album , daft club , shows a wild range i lots of fun . the neptune turn harder , better , faster , stronger into a rob track , while basement jax throw whatever sonic debris they can get their hands from arabic horn samples to vocal squeals into their mix of phoenix . boris lugosi , however , does not do much for digital love . both demon and laidback luke deliver harder versions of face to face and crescendos respectively , but the slum village version of aerodynamic minimizes the wonderful baroque chords and maximizes not - so - wonderful broke rhymes . and just in case you did not get enough of one more time , there has an acoustic version . definitely a mixed bag of a remix album , but still worth checking out .

there has a reason why some songs are made available only over the internet , and it is not because they are too good for ordinary record buyers . these guest remixes might have made for nice freebies , but they do not add up to much of an album . while the 2001 source record , discovery , struck a balance between dance - floor mechanics and prog - disco kitsch , the remixes here opt for either or or , so boris dlugoschs digital love is humdrum house and gonzales too long is fantastic gimmickry . only the neptune stand between daft club and utter irrelevance . they reconstitute harder , better , faster , stronger as offbeat digital soul built around a nagging synth line and pharrell williams great falsetto . not for the first time , they are easily the best thing about a good record .

not very good . not nearly what it could have been . there are maybe some amounted tracks on the whole ad . the rest are complete crap . it pains me to write this review because i am a huge fan , but i have not even had this ad for a day and i am already tired of it .

daft punk are my favourite des of all time . they come out of nowhere and have infectious songs that you cannot get out of the head . this up is just a remix album of their 2001 classic discovery . but it does nothing for me really . i am feelin the aerodynamic daft punk remix . i love the neptune but , their remix to one of my favourite songs of all time harder better faster stronger is just terrible . they should have never touched it at all . sorry neptune . the other remix by jess crabbe us way better . this album should have had more songs from their album . they are missing superhero , quais - vous , and voyager some of the best tracks on the discovery album . this album has the same song just remix . aerodynamic has 3 remixes 2 too many , they should have left something about us alone . i love daft punk but please come with new material so i could forgive you for this dreadful piece .

i do not understand why the rating is so low . the whole album is quality . everyone is expecting a new album altogether ? well it is a remix album , everybody hates those , and this one is actually good , so shut up .

if you bought discovery when it first came out you could get 13 of the 14 tracks as free downloads using the included credit card looking code card to access the daft club website that was up then . i do not think most of these remixes are worth more than the price i paid , that being the time it took to download them for free .

daft club is another great album from daft punk , the techno frenchmen . the theme from interstellar 5555 is on here and is truly an excellent song . aerodynamic is almost better than robot rock but not quite . the neptune and basement jax mixes of harder better faster stronger and phoenix really add to the unique flavor of the albums techno . the only song i hate on here is number ten , a rap remix of a good song that makes it look like crap .

i got this ad recently and have listened to it several times . it is a nice remix to a bunch of daft punks great songs . it is smooth and slowed down with some more vocals in places . very nice ad to listen to . it is not hard techno , but it is a good ad . i definitely recommend it !

simply , nothing i can complain about . some great sounds were released in this album , and of course , a must have for daft punk fans alike . starting off with the overture is a great idea , and is totally the daft sound we have all come to know and love in their first release of homework so many years ago now , and as we all still know their ever adapting sounds are also quite aparent in this release . mostly remixes of thier 2001 released album discovery this verydisco ad , covers every sound you want to hear from funk to house back to funk . lyrics carry us through the whole way . the punks own re - creations in aerodynamic , and crescendos are a great sample of their early work . some songs on this album should not have been toyed winsome amounting phoenix i will admit , my personal fav from homework but aside from that , sit back and enjoy the sounds that other artists have loved enough to remix , and i loved enough to keep me comming back for more .
favorite track on this album . it is the perfect blend of one more time and aerodynamic ! i can not wait for random access memories to come out !
i really like how the album case came . it had a nice tri - fold to it and everything . five stars for sure !

i have been listening to daft punk for a while i have all their groovy electro - pop albums . i am telling you if your into electronic - house music these guys are the best ! homework is a great album fresh is my favorite song , but all of the stuff is my favorite their beats are hypnotyzingly phenomenal . television rules the nation is my anytime favorite , i love daft punk . if you have itunes download a song or if you have livewire just listen to them and you will be crazed by their awesome rhythms

i could practically count the tracks i liked on this album on one hand . although i do agree with some of the reviewers here , harder , better , faster , stronger was one of the better tracks because i like the neptune . i also like the aerodynamic remix by slum village . my favorite track of all time ? aerodynamic ! the tracks that actually made me mad was crescendos , the slow version of too long , and the slow version of one more time . i liked them on discovery , and to hear it on this album made me sick to my stomach . i think the saying , often imitated , never duplicated goes with these tracks , although they did not try to duplicate . and something about us ? they did not even have to touch it . it was fine the way it was . they had some okay remixes , but it lost steam as it went on .

daft club is a remix album by daft punk . some of the songs were already placed on their discovery album , for example , aerodynamics , which is a song that they have been remixed and rearranged with it is order . the overall style of the album lines in parallel with those of their previous efforts . besides the songs on the album appear to be a bit more crunchy than any other daft punk albums .
kinda flatnothing to make you want to dance exactly . i expected some remixes and better beats i guess . nothing really stands outprobably the last daft album i will buy

i have been working in the field of eating disorders as a therapist for about 6 years . i wish i had known of the book earlier . it is written as a self - help book , but is a great source for therapists , as well . it is written in plain and caring language and i think it covers all aspects of a comprehensive treatment .

i ordered this book for the mother of a young woman who is struggling with an eating disorder . i read the book myself before sending it and found it to be very insightful about developing an approach to recovering from such a disorder . i would recommend the book .

when a diet no longer serves you and a demeaning voice inside you takes control of your life , you need carolyn costing and gwen grab . they are eating disorder therapists who know how to empower people to change their destructive eating habits . this book is a journey through the twisted food thoughts that make people think they are in control when they are not . it is all there : thin commandments , food rules , hunger games , food journals , conscious eating , scale addicts , exercise addicts , overeaters , underwater , binge eaters , emotional eaters , rigid beliefs , emotional reasoning , perfectionism , privacy delusions , bulimia , anorexia and purging . these are tough issues to deal with , but with this book , a journal and the right help , there is a way out . richard quis co - author i thinking anew : harnessing the power of belief

this book is the most helpful any other book on eating disorders has been for me . i found it so helpful i ordered a hard copy as i first purchased it as a kindle . very insightful and respectful . as an anorexic who has been throught in patient treatment in the past i found this book to be as much help more than my in patient experience had done . if you are suffering from an eating disorder and want to recover , this is the book for you ! i am now going back over the hard copy and highlighting key items for me to return to as i face my second challenge with my anorexia . i am going to nip this disease in the bud this time and this book is helping me do that .

whether you have an eating disorder or know someone who has an eating disorder , this book offers a great insight and helps one to understand how to cope with and recover from an eating disorder . it gives one strategies to deal with it or understand and help a loved one who may be struggling . thank you carolyn costing . you help us see the light .
i was using it as a self help book , and i have to say i learned a lot even the exercises were very useful , but somehow all the time it had a very depressing effect on me .
this was a great book . i read it slow so i could soak in each key . and i made notes for each chapter . very well written !

this book is great . it has the read and feel of a memoir along with a workbook . i have shared this book with others on the journey to recover from ed . it is a must read ! the writing assignments are great , even if you do not write it out it gives you food for thought pun intended ! this book helped me recognize my vulnerabilities and together with my treatment team overcome the battle and move into recovery . whenever i need a quick pick me up or if my eating disorder tries creeping up on me , i pull out this book .
highly recommend this book for clinicians as well as any person struggling with an eating disorder one of the best books i use in my practice .
a truly amazing resource for understanding eating disorders functions , and learning how one can let go , and embrace recovery .
this is one of the most sensible , realistic books regarding eds that i have read . it has given me hope that my daughter can recover .

i can not say enough about this fabulous book by carolyn costing and gwen schubert grab ! this book is for ; the person in eating disorders recovery , the caregivers whether they are parents , spouses , college health service professionals as well as therapists and others working in the field of eating disorders . the concrete steps and tools included are so powerful and vast , all of the years of experience of these two is immense and they have shared it here for you . there are indeed effective strategies for recovering from an eating disorder . i love using this book with the parents who are lovingly trying to guide their children to recovery . ideally it would be great to see this in the hands of everyone who has ever been diagnosed with an eating disorder . this gives me hope that the millions who have as of yet undiagnosed eating disorders will find help here and see that they too can recover . it is my number 1 recommended book for families looking to help a loved one recover . thank you carolyn and gwen for sharing your hard earned wisdom . becky henry , founder , hope network , lac

i am a clinician at an eating disorder treatment center and upon purchasing this book it has helped immensely with my clients . i use this material both in group therapy and as individual assignment for clients . they all love this book and i have recommended it to every client i see . it is broken down into very manageable keys and provides somewhat like a step - by - step guide through recovery . i feel like my clients can really relate to the stories provided by the authors and is challenging enough to get them thinking deeper about their eating disorder .
i wanted a book for families to understand better . this was not the one . for the patient .

i have quite the library of eating disorders books and feel this is one of the best . easy to read and a great resource for either a clinician or a client . i especially appreciated the exercises suggested in the book and found them to be much more meaningful than some of the other cheesy exercises i have seen .

yes , i liked the story a lot . in fact i did not want it to end . blackbird , by anna cary , is written in second - person narrative , a style i enjoy reading . i found the story to be exciting , fast and heart pumping with an abundance of twists , turns and surprises that should satisfy the craving of just about any adventure junkie . who could not find interesting the situation a young adult female finds herself in : semi conscioussome amounting on subway tracks with a train approaching , and not remembering how she got there or , even , who she is . so , why not five stars ? because a lot , of the story , was left unexplained , and , it ended abruptly . i suspect much will be divulged in the next installment , although . and , i truly do not like it when purchasing a sequel is necessary for fulfillment .

this book is awesome . it is a little jason bourne - lesque in that a beautiful young woman awakens on rail tracks without her memory and has to trace down who she is while she is being hunted literally hunted like an animal by professional hunters tired of hunting wild game . the book is full of oh snap moments that leave the reader on edge , not knowing who to trust , or how the series will end ! great suspenseful ya read !

this book has the strong female character and yes she is fighting for her life in this story , but there is a thrilling mystery about this book that sets it apart from other young - teen novels . it had you wanting to turn the page to find out what will happen next . what does the tattoo mean , why was she on the tracks , who can she trust , are just some of the answers you can not wait to find out in this book .

this book is not recommended . do not waste yur time reading it . without spoiling the plot it seems to be about a late teenage female without a memory of where she came from , how came to be on los angeles subway rails , or even her name . throughout the book she trying to find answers while running around metro la having barely credible adventures . mildly interesting but but nothing is resolved . i found this most unacceptable . mostly i found it immature . i remember writing stuff like this in middle school . my teachers always criticized it as being too undefined and unresolved .

i would sure like to give this ya novel four or five stars , but there has no way . if you have read the other reviews , you are going to be aware of the oddities . there has the 2nd person viewpoint . that is distracting . the ending is unsatisfying . of course , this is bound to be a trilogy , but even so , the ending could have been better . okay , those indeed are legitimate gripes . yet , i liked the main you character . she has me liking her even although she does not know herself . the book is fast paced enough and i did not really want to put it down . so yes , there are issues here , but i like the book and i recommend it . if you can put up with the weird 2nd person viewpoint and the ending , you will like it .

after waking up on the train tracks , a young girl has no idea who she is or what she was doing there . now hiding from the police while trying to uncover her past , she realizes that she has more than just the police to hide from . encountering a young guy selling weed in a gas station , she finally has someone that she can rely on and could consider a friend . this story was incredibly entertaining and super easy to read . there were so many twists and turns that i had no idea what the author was going for until the very end . i absolutely loved this story and can not wait for the next book to come out ! a solid 4/5 .

my 16 year old daughter read blackbird . she enjoyed it and wanted to share her thoughts : this book was intriguing from the start . it is told in second person , which is unusual , and a little weird . it was different . not bad , but definitely different . it was interesting to read a book where the main character has no idea who she is . and we have no idea who she is . it was strange . the book itself was not really scary , but when she starts to figure stuff out i if you actually pause to think about it i it is freaking terrifying . overall , this was not my favorite book , and i did not absolutely love it , but i did enjoy it .
it was too young for me . story line was cliche and that ending came out of nowhere . i would have liked to known a lot more .

in 1924 , richard connell won the o. henry memorial prize for the short story the most dangerous game . this story was the forerunner of many stories , books and movies such as john woos 1993 film hard target , starring jean - claude van damme . blackbird is an extended , modern , urban , ya version of it . since the most dangerous game has been required reading for decades in many schools , there has no need to repeat the plot here . the book is written in a mix of points of view and a mix of fonts to help the reader focus . i found it acceptable , but it lacks the punch of the short story , the horror of john souls the manhattan hunt club an adult version , and the skill of thomas perry dead aim yet another version . in short , there has a familiarity for the reader and the book is designed for a niche audience . it may work for that audience , but may not appeal to any other , such as adults like myself who enjoy ya novels but are accustomed to stronger fare .
if not for the ending , i would have given it 5 stars . i sincerely hope there has a sequel . kept me reading well into the night .

this is quite a thriller ! the story opens on a girl who comes to call herself sunny and all she knows is that she has a weird blackbird tattoo . she does not know who she is , where she came from , and more as the story unfolds there are tons of twists and surprises , which i do not want to spoil . the plot starts right on the first page and then does not ever let up . it has some amazing characters , and descriptions that made me feel like i was right in the middle of the action . it is also very age appropriate , which is great ! although the main character is a girl , this has enough action and adventure that i think it would also be appealing to teenage boys as well . overall , this one is a great read !

i almost unfed this book . almost . maybe the fact that it is not too long helped keep that from happening . i had a really hard time getting into the book in the beginning . i felt like everything was random and i hated feeling so into the dark . but , things started picking up and i really ended up liking it . probably the most important thing to not about blackbird is that it is written in second person . that might be really hard to get past while reading . i know i had some trouble with it . once i got more used to it , i really think it adds the story and helped me understand more about how the main character felt . the only thing that bothered me is that the point of view changes a few times in the book , which made it a bit confusing . the book is full of action , which i love . it is definitely exciting , and once the story picked up it did not take long to read . the ending left me really wanting to know more about all the mysteries surrounding the main character and how everyone is connected to each other .

anna cares blackbird is a mishmash of different stories : amnesia , on the run , people want to kill person , trying not to get distracted by the second person point of view . i mean , i liked it in the sense that it was a fast paced , easy read . there were a few turns although the turns were not surprising . i am not a big fan of second person point of view though . i think i have read one book recently where it was used well but i found it a bit distracting here . to be fair although , the main character nameless girl does not know who she is . also , not every chapter is in that point of view . anyway , i am already looking at picking up the second book in the series so it has piqued my curiosity to see where it goes .

this is another book that did not work for me . i have a feeling it is also another one that many people will like , but for me just did not click . what killed it for me was 2nd person tense . it just made the story too hard to fall into . maybe if the tense were flipped things would have been different . i ended up not finishing this one after a percentage . i have heard that it does get better , but tense aside the story was not working for me either . it just came off as too much and i do not think enough plot was thrown in .

not my usual cup of tea , but blackbird surprised me with the authors ability to pull off this particular style . the story turned out to be quite compelling and although i do not think i would pull it out again for a second read , this was a solid piece of entertaining ya fiction . i was guessing throughout , trying to figure out who to trust and how this could possibly end .

excellent science fiction novella . what a great writer , and interesting story line . the author apparently is very knowledgeable on linguistics , and applied that knowledge skillfully in this story .

my only complaint i have with this short story or novella is it is length . i just did not want the story to end . i know there are some readers who will be turned off by the technical language and explanations , but i found them intriguing . i liked knowing the author had done her homework . the culture understudy by the first contact team deserved more explanation and further illustration . i would love for the author to use this story world again .

i have to give this novella 5 stars , although i would like to rate it lower because i want a full - length book ! alas , it was clear when i bought it that it was a novella , even although i would really like to read more about this world ! i did i make it clear i would like to read more ? ! the author did a great job in choosing to make this a novella instead of a short story . as it is , the author was able to give enough information to create a fascinating world and give us some insight into the culture . as with all great science fiction , everything is not spelled out for you , and even when the world unfolds , the reader will still be left wanting to spend some more time learning about the world and what comes next for the people who are studying and learning about the world . there are definitely enough glimpses into other parts of this world that make me think the author might be writing some more novellas or even , i hope , a novel . after finishing , i went searching for more by this author and ended up buying an anthology . i hope to read more from her in the future .

looking through lace is an excellent story . the story and the characters are quite well written . i have to agree with the other reviewers that this would make an great full length novel . i am a long - time fan of suzette haven elgin and i truly love linguistic of storylines . i will be looking forward to future of stories by this author . highly recommended for of fans .

this is a sci - fi story with a unique perspective . it is a fish out of water tale that examines the ethics of researchers when exposed to an alien social structure . i recommend it to any and all sci - fi lovers

while recuperating from knee surgery i had the pleasure of reading ruth nestvolds looking through lace . i was able to borrow it from a friend , and i am so glad i did . this book is science fiction at it is best . ruth takes you to another world , creates a language that is reasonable although astonishing and gives the readers characters that one can relate to and come to know . i would say to anyone , sci fi reader or not , that this book is on the not - to - be - missed list . i have read science fiction for more years than i will admit to here , and have been looking for an author who will take it up a notch from the run of the mill . ms. nestvold definitely produces ! very well done .

this is a beautiful , novella length , science fiction story centered on a distant planet called christmas the terran tongue . sent on a linguistics expedition to study the distinctly novel language of the female of the species , the team make major breakthroughs in christmas social structure which have major implications for interstellar race relationsand social - economic interaction . i very highly recommend this story for serious science fiction readers . i give this story 4 stars out of 5 based on the following scale : poor read so - so read good read excellent read life changing read

looking thru lace tells the story of a linguist who finds herself on a first landing team to learn the language of women , which differs from the common spoken language . i enjoyed it because of the lead characters strength , and the roundness of the other characters . i enjoyed the twists in plot , and not being able to predict the outcome a long way before the it happened . it was a good read and enjoyable .

i enjoyed this quick read , the characters where well developed . the description of the world was fantastic . i enjoyed the development of the plot and the twist at the end . my only wish is that it had continued .
both simple and complex . feels like a prequel to what could become a fine series . someone with a background in linguists would enjoy reading this .

author : ruth nestvold published by : r.n. age recommend : 16 reviewed by : arena dean raven rating : 5 blog review for : gota review : looking through lace by ruth nestvold was a wonderful fascinating short sci - fi read . this author did a wonderfuljob with the main character , toni donate who was female xenolinguist . her assignment was with the first contact eamon the alien planet christmas to analyze the secret womens language . studying the mean culture . the women spoke a different language that the men were not allowed to learn . why and how did this happen ? however , obstacles are put in place for toni to do her job . the chief linguist dr. reznik began to disrupt her work so she was going to have to do something . how did she accomplish this task ? . well , you will have to read looking through lace to find out . looking through lace wad a well written and worthwhile read . if you a a science fiction lover . this is really a novel for you . the title is perfect for this read and i liked the book cover .

this is an unusual book by ruth nestvold . the topic concerns a woman who studies languages and who is working on a distant planet to learn the languages spoken there . the topic is not one high on my list of interests , but she makes that topic interesting for me , so she did a good job . an interesting i ook . j. robert bank author john wesley , natural man , and the isms

i enjoyed this short story , and i usually never pick one up . if it is not at least 250 pages , it just is not worth the effort . i would read some of the authors previous work , so was curious . very good story with well - rounded characters . i just wish it were longer .
i liked the premise that women were in control on this world . i think that i might have liked it better if it had been all in one book instead of spread out .

looking through lace is the story of toni , a xenolinguist who is assigned to work with a first contact team . she has been relegated to doing grunt work until now , and is really excited for the opportunity to prove herself . the alien world in looking through lace is fascinatingalthough the inhabitants are descended from humans , they have a unique history and culture . the women speak an entirely different language among themselves that the men are not allowed to learn , and toni is determined to figure out how and why that happened . however , she has a jealous senior colleague and the affections of an attractive native who just happens to be in a group marriage to contend with . i enjoyed reading a science - fiction story by nestvold ; all the other work i have read by her has been fantasy . she keeps up the excellent worldbuilding and characters . i found the revelations concerning the history of the world very interesting . the antagonist xenolinguist seemed like a bit of a caricature , but the interesting alien world more than made up for it .

the colors on the card were very pale and the text was light , even with new printer ink cartridges so i was not happy with the way the card looked . what i did like was the ability to print it from my computer because i can give a gift on the same day as the event .

so cute , so bright , so easy to print . what a delight !
